Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung to replace my Vizio and i am amazed by the picture quality,It's a huge step up from a Vizio.I got this tv on sale for $748 its a great tv with beautiful picture.You have to calibrate it because the setting out of the box are not that great.I play xbox360 and Ps3 on it and I see way more than what I used to.I highly recommend this tv.Here are my calibration settings using Disney Wow dvd use these as a starting point to get a amazing pictureMovie modeBacklight:18 can raise or lower if needed does not affect picture qaulityContrast:95Brightness:43Sharpness:50Color:49Tint (G/R):G50/R50Advanced settingColor Space :autoturn everything else off in herePicture Settingscolor tone:standerdHDMI Black Level :normalturn everything else offThis should get you pretty close

Reviews.Title: Great TV and computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Himanshu Amin
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV and computer monitor.  I primarily use it as a computer monitor, and the resolution is fantastic.  A comparable dedicated computer monitor of this size would cost at least 5x.  If using it as a computer monitor make sure that your PC has a dedicated graphics card in order to get a very sharp picture.  It is a great product for the price.

Reviews.Title: SUPER
Reviews.Author: G.B.D.
Reviews.Content: Just got this Samsung 32" EH5000 LED TV, and so far so good. Lots of adjustments, SUPER sound with several choices (movie, music, standard); volume is way beyond what I need, i.e. can get very loud without loss of quality. Several choices for picture size, but they recommend using the max to cover the screen to avoid getting burn-in image...glad I caught this.Easy set-up for DVR with quick call to comcast.I find that the adjustments are almost too many, but did locate settings which I like a lot. There is even a setting to automatically adjust between loud and quieter stations, so that there is no sound-shock (for listeners)...love this.On "movie" sound setting, it's like being in a real movie theater, surround-sound!?There are 2 HDMI's and 1 USB on the side, as well as other connectors in the back.The weight is very acceptable, not heavy at all. Putting the stand screws in was a bit tricky, but diagrams were good. I had to tighten screws more than I expected, but it's sturdy. No swivel adjustment, but it's so light that it doesn't matter.The lateral viewing angle, at least for the settings I chose, is not that great. It's supposed to be something like 175 degrees, but it's maybe 45!? It doesn't bother me, but might bother someone sitting at an angle. But then, I suspect that even THAT could be remedied by mucking around with some of the adjustments.Overall, super TV. A tech-savvy person had told me that Samsung was to be avoided since they had power source problems. I googled and found that in 2008-09 they had some problems, which were long solved. I called Samsung online chat and asked, got a nice rep to talk to.To be super-safe and because this is not a cheap tv, I got the 4 yr extended warrantee for a reasonable $69. I carefully put box and packing away in case I need it.Thanks Amazon! I really really enjoy (and use) the reviews, and the unbelieveably fast delivery (2 days). Best Buy had a similar price, but needed more than 1 1/2 weeks to get the same tv to a store where I could pick it up! (explains Best Buy's recent poor performance).Amazon's price IS the lowest online (free delivery...not sure if this is just for prime which I have).Amazon prime is well worth having in any case, especially for someone like me in a rural area with most shopping areas more than an hour away.Recommend this tv without reservation. It has a great picture, with lots of adjustments, excellent sound quality and not too heavy to lift. The size is very reasonable (less than 29" across) for even a small area, which I have...no need for giant cabinets or wall mounting.This is a "WOW" tv!

Reviews.Title: A great TV, especially considering the price.
Reviews.Author: Fiddle Guy
Reviews.Content: Great picture, and the over-the-air tuner -- or the processing that deals with it -- is much better than both our older Sony and our fairly new Toshiba.  As we have some reception issues I'm EXTREMELY happy with this aspect.Also, the screen is looking great.  I turned off most all of the features, but I am running with 'dynamic contrast' enabled.  I suggest giving it a try.The rest of the review will focus on the 'screen lottery' issue.I purchased this set, and was initially a bit worried due to the version code on the box (see the most helpful critical review) not matching any of the listed version codes.  I couldn't find a definition of "UF04" anywhere.  The set was made in Mexico.  The Samsung rep in the store said that it should be good, acknowledging that the sets coming out of China are of lower quality for budget stores.Anyway, after extensive internet searching I found out how to check the panel manufacturer in the service menu. According to that code (starting with 40A) I have a Samsung panel.  Even before confirming, though, it really did look so good I was getting less and less worried about it.

Reviews.Title: Consider this model even if you don't need 1080p
Reviews.Author: Limmie
Reviews.Content: Ours is only 18 hours out of the box but I'll put in first impressions.- This replaces our old 20" tube television and the 32" LCD is plenty of television in its old location.- We haven't changed settings but the picture looks great in comparison to our 20" tube (ours is the UU02 panel model and I don't know where it stands in the panel lottery issue)!- We purchased this at a big box store.  The price keeps dropping and because of a sale was identical to prices online.  We weren't sure if a 32" was going to be adequate (it is) and we wanted an easier exchange option vs. shipping with an online retailer.  We didn't go with an extended warranty.  There's only a  few % chance of something going bad.  There's a good chance that will occur out of the box or within the exchange period, and even if it doesn't if you pay with a credit card your card company likely already (possibly unknown to you) has a 1 year warranty extension (check).- Sound seems adequate. Not cinema quality and some say "tinny" but I am losing hearing and I need higher frequencies more anyway.  This model has various audio out options if you need them versus the less costly models, but they aren't ideal.  In particular if you plan on using the home theater audio jack, according to others this has one output volume level which cannot be controlled with the remote and you ideally have to have a home system with it own remote.- The stand is a bit flimsy. I have the screws cranked down tightly but there's still play in the joint. I don't think it is going to fall over though.  The TV does not rotate though it looks like it should.- No cable for us. Rabbit ear antenna reception is okay but I have some weak/no signal messages popping up occasionally for some stations that used to come up steady with no problem on our old TV.  I plan on buying a digital TV style antenna.-  I compared many models and hundreds of reviews before buying. It was really down to this or a Sony 32".  I don't think the Sony is bad but technical reviewers didn't give it the best score though consumer reviews give it about the same as Samsung.  Generally the Samsung has more control options.  Both have good and bad things and you have to decide which are critical to you.- 720p vs. 1080p  No need for 1080p with a 32". I couldn't tell the difference in the store until I was about 4 feet from the set.  With no cable, rabbit ears, and only an old DVD player we don't need 1080p.  My reason for going for this set wasn't because I wanted 1080p but because the 720p models don't have other features this one has. The 720p 32" Samsung models have no sound-out capability other than the built-in speakers which don't receive glowing reports.  This model does have audio outputs (though limited) in addition to probably somewhat better sound than the lower cost models. That may be adequate and we won't need to buy a sound bar or pay to upgrade audio on current our home system (a boombox). Save $100 there.  Samsungs additionally have pretty good media player support (photos, multiple video formats, etc.)  Getting a Samsung save $40 for a separate media player.  In a nutshell, it was cheaper paying a bit more for the 1080p model simply for the other features than saving $50 on 720p model which would require separate support features.- Two HDMI ports is more than enough for us with one DVD player. It would have been nice hiding HDMI on the back since I do not anticipate changing connections all the time and we'll have to see it sticking out the side all the time.  Having the USB port on the side is handy where I do see changing the flash drive frequently.- The manual is printed on a large sheet of paper. I see needing to reference if frequently and it would have been nicer in booklet format. No dealbreaker.- I'd give this 4.5 stars but that isn't an option.  Frankly if I insist upon reserving 5 stars for the perfect TV I don't think I'll ever find one and docking a whole star for a minor laundry list isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing For The Price...
Reviews.Author: PsychDoc
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I'm a bit of a TV snob. I have the latest/greatest Panasonic plasma (the VT60) in my den. This is my bedroom TV and it replaced an older 720p Toshiba. I'm amazed at the difference. While it can't possibly equal the black levels of the VT60 or its color depth or nuance it's damn good. Razor sharp images, great white levels, excellent flesh tones and good viewing angles (long a pet peeve of mine with LCD/LED's). I want to make particular note of the built-in speakers. Way better than the outgoing Toshiba and much better than the speakers on the VT60. As we all know, sound quality is one area in which flat panels have compromised. Sometimes to the point that the consumer is almost forced to go to an external speaker solution (as I did with the VT60). Not so here. The sound quality is actually well above average and has a resonable amount of bass for such a small system. Is it audiophile quality? Heck no! But it's great for everyday viewing/listening and can even do justice to music with wide dynamic range. While most flat panels give their speakers 2 or 4 watt amplifiers, this has two 10 watt amplifiers built in. This makes a huge difference at moderate (to louder) levels and keeps things sounding clean and non-distorted. For a TV costing well under $500 this unit is incredible. If you want bells and whistles or a smart TV you're going to want to looks elsewhere. If you want a TV that serves as a monitor for your cable/fios feed then this is your answer.BTW for those of you concerned about the "outsourced panel" issue let me say that I have the HS03 version (made by Sharp I'm told). It really is superb so have no worries. ;-)

Reviews.Title: Good TV, bad packaging and shipping
Reviews.Author: thex
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV.  I would recommend it to anyone.  The only real complaint I have is the limited number of HDMI jacks.  There are only two.  This, plus the component video input provide only three HD inputs.  Too few if you have very many components.  The big problem here is the packaging and shipping.  The Samsung packaging only protects the ends of the TV.  The screen is woefully vulnerable to impact damage with no protection other than a thin layer of cardboard.  Combine this with the apes working at UPS and its a formula for trouble.  If you remember the old American Touristor commercial with a gorilla beating the hell out of a suitcase, you have an idea of what my shipment went through.  Needless to say, the screen was completely hammered.  It looked like someone at UPS drop kicked it.  I returned the damaged unit without replacement.  I didn't wish to play UPS Russian Roulette a second time.  I bought the same item at Sears on sale for about the same price.  Being my own deliveryman, I refrained from kicking the box and the TV made it home intact.  One good note, Amazon's return process was flawless, easy and my credit card was credited with the refund in one day.  My complements to Amazon on this.  Too bad Mighty Joe Young at UPS made the return necessary.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for not too much
Reviews.Author: S. Smith
Reviews.Content: Really enjoy the USB port to plug in a portable hard drive to watch movies and shows.  The formats playable are a little limited so if this is the reason your purchasing the TV I would suggest a little reasearch to see what it is capable of playing.  The picture quality isnt quite the same as another Samsung I purchased, but for the price this tv is prety great.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, false advertising
Reviews.Author: Mad
Reviews.Content: On amazon, it says this tv is 120 Hz. That is not the case, the 120 refers to Samsung's own invention of CMR (clear motion rate). It is impossible to tell what the framerate of this tv is, but it is NOT 120 hz. It seems that Samsung advertising no longer discloses the true framerate (60-120-240hz) but instead uses a term called "True Motion Rate". The website calls this a figure based on 3 factors--framerate, processor speed, and backlight management.No where in the advertising or published specs can I find the actual framerate.

Reviews.Title: Had to return
Reviews.Author: V. Changsao
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this TV. Samsung is known for selling quality LCDs but this must have been the exception. Out of the box the picture is noticeably bad. I did play with the settings and used a couple of the recommended settings I've seen online (including the one in the Amazon review) and still found the picture to be awful. I used various sources (xbox, cable) and even had my cable company (Fios) change my box but this picture was still unacceptable. Sports especially looked terrible as there was always trailing on fast movement. I have even had several guests come to my house and ask me what is wrong with my television.Ultimately I had to return this tv and eat a $50 return fee for shipping. I since then went to a Vizio and I am very happy. There are too many good LCDs on the market to settle for this one.

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Kati
Reviews.Content: The price of this TV was outstanding.  I checked a few other retailers, and Amazon's price was by far the best.  Shipment was remarkably fast, too; it arrived in about two days without having selected any special shipping (I picked the standard option of 5-8 days).  Reminded me again just how much I love Amazon.I've only had this TV for one day, so I can't comment on its longevity.  The picture quality is great.  Though other reviews note that picture settings need adjusted, the out-of-the-box settings for me were just fine; however, if you need to adjust, it's easy to do so.  The menu and options are easy to navigate.  Set-up was easy and the sound is good.  Up until now, I had a 37" then a 42" in my living room, so I was unsure what a 50" would look like, but the size is perfect.I LOVE the USB capability to watch videos--it's so convenient to put my home videos of my daughter onto a flash drive instead of having to burn them all to a DVD.  The menu for the USB is super-simple; it lists all the video files so you can select what you want, but then it cycles through them automatically, going to the next when one is finished.  Such an easy way to view home videos, I love it.Had I read the manual, I may have been able to find this out, but the buttons on the actual TV are hard to find!  I ran my hand over the TV, searched the sides, etc., and couldn't find them, to the point I figured there weren't any.  Turns out, it's more like a joystick-esque kind of button.  You put your hand under the TV, right near where the red light is, and there's one big button that you press in various places to navigate to the off switch or to a couple other options.  It's easy, just hard to find if you don't know what you're looking for.In short, I'm just an average TV-watcher.  I don't know anything about picture and sound quality aside from just looking at the screen.  I don't know what the experts look for--I just like watching Netflix movies and my favorite shows.  I'm not hard to please; I still have a huge 90s TV in my computer room, and I watch it with no problems.  On this TV, HD channels look amazing.  It's simple to use, big enough to fill my space, and makes me feel like I'm watching TV in some sort of luxury.  50" is bigger than any TV I've ever owned, and I'm very pleased that I chose this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for myself a few months ago and have been very satisfied with it. The picture quality is superb on both blu-ray through my PS3 and the digital local channels. Sound is strong for built-in speakers. Set-up is very easy.

Reviews.Title: This was purchased for my mother to watch football and the news on.
Reviews.Author: wizardshat
Reviews.Content: Nice screen. Good color. Fairly sharp picture. Samsung makes reliable and good looking consumer TVs. This one is a fairly basic edition of their product line. It works well with my mother's satellite TV receiver. She is happy with it. I have a different brand of TV at my house and I think that mine looks a bit better and costs about the same. I have lost a little faith in Samsung since two of their Galaxy Tabs have both died in about a year of use. They used to be a top of the line company, now I think that they are in the middle of the playing field.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Houston
Reviews.Content: I had a 3000 series and I wanted to try the 5000 and I can tell a big difference on the display.AMAZON rocks with the shipping speed, this is a good quality tv for that price, cheaper than any other store.

Reviews.Title: Best purchase I've ever made
Reviews.Author: Ursula
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing. I have never been much of a TV watcher, but after getting an Xbox, I decided it was time to upgrade mt TV. I am now constantly watching TV. This Samsung TV has so many features and options. Beautiful screen quality and movie theater audio. I love this so much and I think I paid a good price for it. I think everyone should get this.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Kyle Hedden
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect for people who just want to watch TV or play games.  It looks great with my XBOX ONE and is super clear. There is no reason to buy a "Smart TV"  with todays consoles and boxes so save some money and just get this one.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV for games and blu-rays.
Reviews.Author: Andres Sarmiento
Reviews.Content: This is a solid HDTV pretty much all you need if your not looking for any of those smart TV's with all the apps. Just like with every TV, once you get it, your going to have to tweak with the Picture settings. I went by what some people posted, but I found some of them were too damn bright so here's mine. Hopefully it's helpful.Mode: MovieBacklight: 16Contrast: 85Brightness: 50Sharpness: 10Color: 50Tint: 50/50Color Space: AutoGamma, Dynamic Contrast, Black Tone, Flesh Tone: 0 or offColor Tone: Warm1Size: Screen FitDigital Noise: offHDMI Black Level: LowLED Motion Plus: off

Reviews.Title: I love this TV for my computer monitor
Reviews.Author: S. Siders
Reviews.Content: I ran across this 32-inch 1080p TV while shopping for a good HD computer monitor and I love it. The sound is a lot better/deeper than the 720p LCD it replaces. In general, I think the sound is really good. The inputs are limited to 3 HDMI’s but it suits my purpose. My only criticism, albeit a small one, is that I’d like for it to be a few more inches off the stand. As is, it sits about 1.5 inches off the surface of my desk. That by no means was a deal breaker for me, as there are other ways I could raise it if I decide too.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Mike Wessner
Reviews.Content: good product. ... a bit pricey for this tv.  Samsung does always deliver....I also have a fancier 46 inch and love it

Reviews.Title: Sharp
Reviews.Author: Tool and tech
Reviews.Content: TV has a very sharp picture.  We've used this for a little over a year now with great success.  Samsung TV's have great quality and this is no exception.

Reviews.Title: Next to my new car, it was next best present!
Reviews.Author: Scott Carrillo
Reviews.Content: I love this tv, even when I'm watching a bad movie. The screen is sooo much better than my tube tv. The low profile trim is nice too, you don't have a chunky plastic frame to distract from the screen.The size is nice so it doesn't take away from the decor or feel of the room.

Reviews.Title: Great tv, great price, great picture
Reviews.Author: D. Johnston
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv at a great price. It's not a smart tv, it only has 2 hdmi inputs, it's only 60hz, etc, etc. However, if you are like me, and you didn't need any of these things, then look no further. I use my blu-ray player for all "smart tv" functionality, and a separate receiver/surround sound system for sound. The sound is lacking, and while it was acceptable for the average viewer, the home theater system is a tremendous upgrade. It did require some tweaking to make the picture look perfect, and everyone's panel will be slightly different, but here are a few settings I used for a great picture in case anyone finds it helpful:Mode: StandardSharpness: 0Color Space: AutoDynamic Contrast: OffBlack Tone: OffMotion Lighting: OffColor Tone: StandardHDMI Black Level: NormalLED Motion Plus: OffYou may notice that I left most video processing options off - that's because Samsung's "improvements" just aren't that good. They either made the picture worse, or they looked too fake, with too many shadows, jagged lines, etc. There are some complaints as well about the panels not being made by Samsung. I don't feel that this should dissuade anyone from buying this tv. It is very common for a tv manufacturer to use a different company's panel in their branded tv. For what it's worth, I ended up with a non-Samsung panel, and the picture is great, absolutely no complaints. If it is a concern for you, I would recommend purchasing an extended warranty, and then there is nothing to worry about. When it's all said and done you are still going to come out ahead compared to the price you would pay for a higher end tv in this size.

Reviews.Title: JPG problems
Reviews.Author: W. Dart
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to write a review as there are so many with plenty of answered questions, but after having this unit for over a year I discovered something I thought I should report on.When I inserted a USB flash drive with JPGs it seemed to get very erratic with time.  It displayed all the JPGs in each folder less and less and finally would not display or load any and would revert back to the TV.  When I terminated the session I found the TV clock and calender had been reset to zero.  "Rebooting" the TV is the only cure.Just a warning.  As far as a TV goes it is great.

Reviews.Title: Great brand, great price, great product.
Reviews.Author: alex gyftogiannis
Reviews.Content: Just got the TV so this short review is purely based on under a week of ownership, but so far it's beautiful. I was blown away by how crisp the picture quality was compared to my older, smaller Samsung LCD. Considering the price I paid I feel this TV is a total bargain. If it's anything like my other Samsung I have a feeling it will last me a very long time. I feel like the actual stand could be a bit sturdier but that's a minor gripe. The menus are pretty intuitive making setup and navigation simple and the TV only weighs just under 30 pounds making it easy to move and transport. I can't really find much to complain about. I love this TV so far and would recommend it for anyone on a budget that can't necessarily afford the most expensive stuff out there.

Reviews.Title: Good at the start.  Then issues will come up after a few month.
Reviews.Author: Chase Craig
Reviews.Content: Worked fine for the time I had it.  Then it started getting these weird issues after maybe 2 months.  First off it started to shut on and off on its own.  I already checked the auto shutoff feature and disabled it after setting it to factory defaults.  The it started getting issues where it wouldn't display any inputs.  Restarted again and it just went away.  Around December 2nd it straight up wouldn't turn on.  I got it refurbished so im weighing that against the issues but from what I understood from doing research is that these TV's have capacitor issues where Samsung put capacitors that were not up to par with the tv's performance and would either 'pop' or straight up not work.I have contacted Samsung and the repair price to replace said capacitors is around 100 U.S. dollars.  Which the capacitors themselves are worth 5 and there are at least 4 of them inside.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV-1080p
Reviews.Author: goldgodess
Reviews.Content: great tv for a great price!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Top quality picture and sound .  The setup was easy and the set is extremely lightweight.  This is our 3rd HDTV-repeat purchase of Samsung.  We find they have the best quality and reliability.

Reviews.Title: Problem with shipping
Reviews.Author: SSth
Reviews.Content: Day 1 of this product and I'm reviewing it till now. The shipment was done by Fed Ex which was very very terrible. They made me go from one place to another for pick up. Very frustrating and horrible customer service.The product is very light and very easy to install. Review coming from a person who does not watch TV much, overall it looks easy and simple. The color quality is pretty good. But the sound like almost all have commented, is pretty small. But I guess that's what you get for having a thin TV. Looked good for my 1 BR apartment. Very very disappointed for having just 1 USB port. Thinking of having any other ways for Google Chromecast !!

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Marrero
Reviews.Content: I have two sets of 40" Samsungs, one bought in 2012 and the other on 2013. I have to say they are excellent. After tweaking the settings the image quality is outstanding! Just beware of buying a Samsung panel TV and not a Sharp or worse one! look for the code guide in previous reviews for help, also look for the correct settings in previous posts. I bought mine at Sears, and the both came with the good panels, so that's it.

Reviews.Title: Top-Notch
Reviews.Author: JUSTIN C DOZIER
Reviews.Content: It has a great picture, great sound, and is very lightweight. It is also easy to install anywhere in the house that the screen will fit.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great value
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: It's basically what you'd expect from reading the specs; I'm very happy with it and would definitely recommend it for small and medium sized rooms.My ONLY complaint would be about swapping between inputs.  The remote only allows you to 1. open the list of source inputs 2. navigate to the one you want and 3. select that one.  I would much prefer having a button in addition that one, which would just let me cycle through active inputs by repeatedly hitting it.  Since I often switch between only two active inputs, the extra time it takes to pick the right input seems unnecessary.  If that feature existed, I would happily rate this product a 5.That aside, you should strongly consider this TV; it's a solid product and great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Need remote to work
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Herrick
Reviews.Content: The only instructions that came w/ the set were for assembly of the TV to the stand.  No set-up sheets were included.  You CAN scan a code on the box w/ a smart phone for further instructions.  Only problem?  I don't have a smart phone yet.  So, at this point, I have no working remote control and no way of using any of the set's advanced features.

Reviews.Title: The research paid off!
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: This television was very easy to set up.  I use a Leaf antenna to avoid high cable fees and the HD stations are beautiful.  This set is very light weight and stays cool due to being LED/LCD.  The remote also has lighted keys for operating in the dark.  The price was in line with other sites.  So far, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: The picture is phenomenal
Reviews.Author: Ziba
Reviews.Content: What this TV lacks in size, it makes up for in picture quality. It feels like a 3D experience when we watch this TV. I highly recommend it as you cannot ask for better quality for this incredible price.

Reviews.Title: Great as a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Cooking Llama
Reviews.Content: I hooked this baby up last night, and it is awesome.  It did take some playing with to get it set up, since I'm using it as a computer monitor instead of a TV.  There are a bunch of people who claim it's too dark, but that's why there's a brightness setting, but I digress... This TV has great clarity, and it's got a nice, sturdy base. Just don't strip a screw like I did. It means the base is permanent now.

Reviews.Title: best screen i've used
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I am using this as a computer screen it's great! all my games on my PC look amazing. I would suggest this for anyone into gaming or in 3d production or photoshop fields.

Reviews.Title: A good buy
Reviews.Author: ms_mac1 "Mac"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product on Amazon after reviewing the ratings on many sites and comparing the price in many stores.  I haven't had any problems with the TV so far.  Loving the sleek design.  I'm a happy customer.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for bedroom
Reviews.Author: Alex B "Al"
Reviews.Content: This is not the slimmest, nor the greatest TV, but works very well for the bedroom. I chose it, for it's decent picture quality and the full-array LED back-light in such an inexpensive TV (got it on Black Friday sale). It is however very basic.No smart TV features - that was intentional as I dislike the Samsung Smart Hub for 2011/2012. Only 2 HDMI inputs.It has fairly basic picture quality settings, but they are good enough to good decent PQ, without becoming overly confusing.Overall, a solid, middle of the road TV for the bedroom, but there are better choices out there for the (no-sale) price point.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Lisa Niebruegge
Reviews.Content: This TV replaced one in our bedroom. The picture is crisp and refresh rate is good for motion (like sports, racing, or video games). The sound quality is good and was easy to connect to blue ray or DVD player. Very happy with this TV and Samsung. We have two other Samsung TVs in our home and have been happy with those, which is why we bought Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Samsungfan
Reviews.Author: Jonny "JL"
Reviews.Content: Originally bought this as a PC monitor, but realized the pixelation was bad. However, as a tv, it doesn't get much better for the price. Perfect tv for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: JoshM5683
Reviews.Content: Ok I have a Samsung D8000 in my living room and liked the Samsung tv so much I got this for my bedroom.  Its a great compliment to the bedroom.  The picture is clear and looks great.  The 60hz refresh rate, I know some people complain about it, but honestly since nothing currently is shot over 24fps 60hz is just fine.  Obviously the 240hz refresh rate on the D8000 has that artificial smoothing effect, but I can't tell a big difference between the 2 pictures.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that on the D8000 I can hook a USB drive and watch movies/tv shows/3D content off the USB device.  I don't know if its just because this model is a few years older, but it does not play back all the formats that the 8000 does.  Not a big deal if you don't use an external media device, but something to be aware of if you are.  Thus far mainly it has been tv shows that haven't played back, most movies seem to work.  I would definitely recommend this tv to anyone that asked me about it.

Reviews.Title: An Exceptional Value for the price paid!
Reviews.Author: Secteur Cyclist
Reviews.Content: What I wanted was a well priced 40-46 inch LED TV with exceptional picture and I believe I got what I wanted.Whether it was back or side lid did not matter to me as the thickness hardly compares with the unit it replaces. 3-4 inches may be considered thick in today's LED TV standards, but not in this price range and/or from this manufacturer.I stumbled upon a sale at a local retailer last week and picked up the last available Samsung UN40EH5000F.This one is made in Mexico and the official Version stamped on the box label is HS03. I read that the HSxx sets have a Sharp screen in them, not a Samsung one, and it may be slightly inferior.I tried the picture setting listed by other reviews on this set and I could not be happier with the picture produced. It offers rich vivid colors and there is a significant range for adjustment. The only negative I have to share about this TV set is displaying of black. It has a slight ghosting effect. That being said, in this price range you will be hard pressed to find a better set. I am willing to live with this minimal nuisance knowing I did not overextend myself to purchase a significantly more expensive set, just because of this one thing.The audio quality is also on par with higher priced TVs, for those of you who will not venture out and spend money on a separate audio system.There are only 2 HDMI ports on this model. You may only be able to plug in 2 sources at the same time. In my case: HD cable box and a Roku 2 XS streaming player. The ports are on the right side of the set, instead of the back panel so this may be a consideration for some. Cables do not stick out from the side of the TV as they bend back and behind. The TV comes with a small stick-on cable organizer.The USB port is positioned right below the HDMIs and works well with my powered external hard drive and usb thumb/flash drives formatted in FAT and FAT32 (exFAT was not recognized by the set).For the price I paid, I am very happy with the purchase.I opted in for a 4 year warranty through the local retailer just in case. TVs tend to be used long term and I hope the circuits on this set last as long as past Samsung products.While this is not a "smart" tv, it comes with a media player (for the USB delivered content) and I have yet to feed it something it has not been able to play. I am impressed by the file support.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Jane Q Public
Reviews.Content: I bought this television a couple of weeks ago for the bedroom and after some tweaking I am very impressed with the picture quality. I have it hooked up to a Standard TiVo and the picture looks really good. I'm sure it would be superb if hooked to an HD DVR. I did purchase a Sony Blu Ray for it and it looks wonderful.  My living room tv is an older Sony Bravia XBR. I must admit the picture quality on the Sony is better but for the price difference I would not say it is significant enough to warrant spending the extra money. The sound quality is also very good. I would rather it had been 120hz but the 60hz seems sufficient. I received the TS01 Version.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: bmac32
Reviews.Content: Early Christmas present. Wife was quite pleased simply by the size and after three nights she even commented on how better the picture was. Went from LCD to LED, much better colors and a much better picture overall.

Reviews.Title: Works as promised
Reviews.Author: Lowtech
Reviews.Content: The picture is superb, the color crisp and dazzling, the setup easy.  Glad i was able to find this at a good price.

Reviews.Title: perfect TV for the bedroom
Reviews.Author: brainwhistle "brainwhistle"
Reviews.Content: Got this a month or so ago as a TV for the bedroom. The size is just about perfect, and the almost total lack of a bezel makes it look great. You get a nice big screen in a small packageimage quality is very good, and the sound surprisingly acceptable -- i feared i was going to need a sound bar, but for this use, it's perfectly adequate.Had originally thought about getting a smart TV, but after a decent amount of research (online and in-stored) decided to go for a non-smart TV with an external VOD device -- am using it with a roku device (and BluRay player) rather than cable. if it could switch automatically to the BR input when a signal came from it, that would be best -- maybe would need to get a Samsung player for that though (am using an older Sony box at the moment).and for the price, it was a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32-inch LED-HDTV (Model.:UN32EH5000)
Reviews.Author: norreim
Reviews.Content: This will be a very brief, specific review: The TV pictures are vibrant color quality and the ease of operation and hook-up is absolutely, positively EXCELLENT! Really, what more would you need to know?  Oh, the TV supporting base, which allows for horizontal and vertical adjustment of the TV, is easily removable so you can hang the TV on the wall. You'll enjoy this TV :-) Internet search revealed that "Samsung" is a quality, dependable, and long lasting TV. Thanks, AMAZON.COM for the competitive lower-than-retail price.

Reviews.Title: Great Samsung TV!
Reviews.Author: Expertreviewer
Reviews.Content: The Samsung 32" has an outstanding picture. This is the best TV that we have in the house and we have everything from larger LCD, Plasma and smaller LED.  Before buying this set, I tried a 32" Phillips and a Vizio which were both sent back because they each had issues.  The Phillips could not see the resolution properly from my Direct TV box and was a real pain to keep resetting the resolution of the Direct TV box.  The Vizio screen was not good and varied in brightness depending upon where you stood and took a long time to start up.  The Samsung starts quickly, reads my direct tv box resolution perfectly and is overall a terrific picture. The audio is surprisingly good as well.  A few things of interest:TV does not have an S Video connector.  It does have a couple of HDMI and Regular component and antenna connections but no S-Video.TV is thicker than the 1" thin units but is still thinner than the older style units.  Unit is pretty light and easy to handle.The underneath joystick type menu and controls button is a little wierd but I never use it anyway.  Remote is perfect.Motion - this TV handles fast motion like sports extremely well.HD Quality on this set is absolutely outstanding.Remote is nice and small about 6" long and about 1.5" wide.  Easy to use button layout.No angle adjustment on the stand.  Stand attaches easily with a few screws and can be removed for wall mounting.Menu functions allow for a lot of control and adjustments.Overall this is a very good television.  I use it off of a direct tv box and as a back-up with an over the air antenna.  Both signals provide an excellent picture.

Reviews.Title: A nice smaller flat screen
Reviews.Author: VideoBob
Reviews.Content: My initial impressions was, "Wow, this thing sure is light!"  I had just removed a Samsung LNS3251DX from our dining room swivel wall mount, and realized how heavy it was.  The new one was 14 pounds vs. 28 for the older model.  Mounting was easy, and it was very quick to hook up and adjust.  We are on both an antenna, and satellite (Direct TV.)  Scanning the available channels took the normal amount of time, and it did a good job of selecting all those we had had before, plus maybe a couple others.It did require some adjustment as others have noted.  Adjustments were easy, but I have had experience with two other Samsung flat screens.  I did use some of the setting numbers posted here as starting points.  I will not include what I ended up with as these things are personal preferences, and room lighting will always make a difference.  I was close to what several others used.I would say that this new TV isn't quite as good when viewed from an angle as the older model.  This isn't a problem with us as it is rare that someone is in both the kitchen and dining room.  The swivel takes care of that.  The sound is perhaps a tad bit better, and the volume control is a little more precise.  One problem we were never able to solve with the older set was sound dropping out when something on the same circuit was turned off.  The refrigerator door closing always caused a two-second pause in the sound.  Not any more!  It also seems to have a slightly more sensitive receiver for off-the-air signals.  I do not notice any motion blur that some see as a problem.Picture quality is better, but not up to the larger Samsung in the family room.  Also, it doesn't have the "ghosting" problem when the screen fades to black as did the earlier 32" set.  Contrast is obviously better.  I do like the "joy stick" control for those times when the remote decides to hide from me.  What we really need is a remote to turn on the beeper on the remote...All in all, a nice upgrade compared to the 720 pixel device it replaced.  If you are looking for a TV that will be viewed from odd angles, I might look elsewhere.  If not, I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: replaced sony lcd to this!
Reviews.Author: Danny P. Matthews
Reviews.Content: Overall great TV only have two exceptions, First wished they would have put the hdmi connectors more in the middle and facing downward, The HDMI cable is on the side and sticks out somewhat. because I run it through a concealment strip on the wall where the TV is mounted ( I use it as a computer monitor). and secondly the picture is slightly over saturated with the HDMI and no you cannot adjust the "color" setting through HDMI. It seamed to me the reds had a little to much "bloom" to them.You will have to adjust the picture settings to your liking they are not properly set from "out of the box". I have adjusted picture settings for years for friends and myself, using Avia DVD ESSENTIALS. So I am somewhat familiar with proper picture adjustments.but I am no trained technician either.my settings on this TV is as follows:back light  18contrast  98brightness  45sharpness  46HDMI black level  normal.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Bobbie J "Barb"
Reviews.Content: This T.V. was the best purchase we ever made. The sharp, clear picture allows my husband and family to watch our favorite television programs and feel as if we are part of the program due to the High Definition. Great buy, great price!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32" LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: JFE
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN32EH4000 32-Inch 720p 60 Hz LED HDTVFor the price this is a great TV in every respect. I researched 32 inch LED TV's for six months, comparing every brand, and kept coming back to this one. I finally ordered mine from Amazon.com and was delighted with the service, the prompt free delivery by UPS, and the fact that Amazon accepted my bonus points from Discover Card as part of my payment.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV!
Reviews.Author: Jethro
Reviews.Content: Finally got around to replacing the old 27" TV in the bedroom with a Samsung 40" LED!  I can't get over how good the picture quality is on this TV.  Then I hooked it up to a Blu-Ray player and now I may never leave my bedroom. Great TV for the price and better picture than I expected.  I got an LCD TV in my living room that I've had for a few years, might be time to replace that one too.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: JHO
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV recently and have no regrets.  Great picture, the clarity and the definition is stunning.  I watch a lot of travel and nature shows, as well as sports.  I do not think the picture can be any better than what I get when I am watching in HD.  It is easy to use and the other thing I like is the design.  Very sleek and complements my living room well.  Would definitely buy again and recommend to friends and family.  Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought it
Reviews.Author: beachgirl
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this TV.  I didn't set it up myself, so I can't speak to how easy it was, but my friend had it set up in no time. The picture is great, as is the sound.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that, as another person mentioned, it doesn't turn on instantly. I guess I shouldn't be so picky, but at first I thought it wasn't turning on and would hit the power button multiple times. Perhaps that says more about my patience level! It really only takes a couple of seconds to turn on, so it's not such a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Love my Samsung
Reviews.Author: Queen 11
Reviews.Content: I got this Samsung TV fir my daughter as a graduation gift but it is sooo good that I had to get one for me too. I totally recomend, image is great!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Stewart Brown
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV last weekend to replace a 4 year Old Vizio 32 LCD 720p.Setup was a snap. Have Direct tv connected via HDMI, PS3 via HDMI. and a rooftop Antenna connected to the Coax/ OTA.Running TV thru a Yamaha 5.1 surround System.I am using the TV's Digital Optical out for sound when watching OTA TV broadcast which look and sound great thru the Yamaha Receiver.Using a digital coaxial cable for Audio for my Direct tv, and the audio from PS3 run HDMI.  The TV does need some tweaking/ Fine Tuning. I thought the picture was too dark until I changed it to Dynamic. I actually used the settings one of the previous reviewers posted.Compared to my old Vizio, wow, big difference. Watching the 1080i broadcast of the US Open was amazing. Playing FIFa Soccer was incredible. Big difference from the 720p.  Overall, happy with this purchase. But only 2 HDMI ports??? and they are located on the side of the TV which makes for cable clutter.I did view some photos and Videos using the Usb port with usb thumbdrive. very seamless.  Look no further if your looking for a solid tv for your Bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great as a PC monitor
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I wanted to upgrade from my 24in 60hz gaming monitor. I was skeptical going with a TV instead of a dedicated monitor but once I got this TV properly setup it is so crisp and clear at 1080p it is unreal. I'm very happy with this TV and would recommend it to any gamer trying to stay on a budget and away from 120hz monitors that really start climbing in price. I use this with a GTX 780 in my system and play BF4 and other games and it looks better than it did on my monitor.One thing that is an absolute MUST for PC users: Make sure you actually change the "name" of the source. You will select HDMI, but also go into Edit Sources in the menu and change the source name to "PC", it makes all the difference.I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Just "Okay" TV - UN50EH5000
Reviews.Author: TheWorldFamousJOM
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big techie, I just wanted a decent quality TV that came out of the box with a good picture, good sound, and no real problems.  I read reviews until my eyes bled.  I settled on Samsung after seeing too many repeat issues of "died after 2 weeks" on a few other popular brands.  All I can say after 5 weeks is that I am underwhelmed with this particular model.I did my shopping in several stores and compared TV's side-by-side.  I kept thinking "well, the picture on the Samsung isn't as good as the (Sony, Vizio, LG, etc), but if the quality and reliability is better, I won't notice the picture so much when it's in my living room and I don't have another TV right next to it".  Wrong...  Every single day I am considering returning it and trading for a better picture.  Thanks to some other smart techie reviewers, I discovered that there are different panels in some of the same model TV's so maybe I got the low-end, I don't know.  I researched online about fine-tuning ("calibrating") your own TV, and with a little time investment of about 3 hours of research and fiddling around, I did see a very small improvement.  And I know that I can pay ANOTHER $300 for a trained person to come in and do a 'professional' calibration for me, but for $300 more up front, I could've bought a better TV in the first place!Specifically, my picture is not crisp, maybe even a little cloudy/milky.  I don't notice any dead spots - it's just blah all over.  HD tv channels do appear better than non-HD, but even then it's not impressive.  The sound volume is pretty good, and when I play a Blue-Ray disc through it, it sounds amazing.  Non-Blue-Ray sound is just like an old 19" TV from 20 years ago.  When I put a disc or DVR show on pause, there is a very noticeable humming/low-freq buzz sound that seems to just leak out of the TV speakers (that's from two different inputs, so it's probably not a feed problem).  The menu is a pretty good for picture control, and lousy for sound.  (And one feature I liked on my old TV from 1999 that this one doesn't have is subtitles, esp when the TV is muted.  Wish that was a standard by now.)My whole point is that this TV is not what I expected; it's not terrible but for anyone else wanting to be "Wow'ed" right out of the box, this may not be the right one for you either.  I chose to buy a TV with a worse picture that will last me a longer time, rather than a better picture which will die sooner.  That's life in the mediocre lane, I guess.....

Reviews.Title: OMG I LOVE THIS HDTV!!!!
Reviews.Author: That™ Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: what can i say? i am really impressed with this HDTV and its price... after having it for 2 months, i am loving it... very very clear picture... i can download movies on my flash drive and watch it or i can connect my computer via HDMI port and play Battlefield 3 flawlessly... even the audio was surprisingly excellent!... and my Directv HD works wonderful as well... i'm thinking of investing in another one for my bedroom...

Reviews.Title: What TV do you get?
Reviews.Author: A Nitkiewicz
Reviews.Content: Samsung - UN32EH5000FXZA - is a 120 hz. but the "Samsung UN32EH5000 32 1080p LED-LCD TV - 16:9 - HDTV 1080p - 120 Hz" is not. and that is according to Samsung's website. It's only a 60 hz. Besides that The 120 hz TV is under $400 at Samsung so why would we get it here?Clarity in advertisement would help so we would know what TV we are going to get..Shop around thats all i can say and check the specs before you buy anything.. you're on the web already can't be that much harder..

Reviews.Title: Perfect picture but clouding problems!!!
Reviews.Author: thebugslaaaa
Reviews.Content: The picture on this set is amazing for the price. It does need a bit of tweaking from factory settings, but nothing too major. (Contrast and brightness turned down a bit etc.) HD content looks stunning and colors are spot on.The problem with this tv is very common with edge-lit led tvs recently, it's called clouding or flash lighting. You can only notice it at night with a near black screen on. (Such as switching the tv to an input with no device connected.) I noticed on my set that there were large bright spots or "clouds" all over my screen! Also in the corners there are bright blooming artifacts that are so annoying at night time!!! (flash lighting) Turning the back light and brightness down at night helps a bit but black.In conclusion this TV has as good of screen performance as the more expensive series without costing nearly as much. Only negative is the clouding which I have seen on every single samsung and lg set I have ever owned. As long as you can live with the screen uniformity problems I say go buy this set! But if you are one of the more OCD tv nuts out there like me, you may want to stick with your plasma for a few more years until the build quality of these lcd/led sets improves a bit more! All in all great tv with minor quirks.

Reviews.Title: NOT 120 Hz
Reviews.Author: Wookiegonewild
Reviews.Content: Research the model number.  This is not a 120 Hz TV.  Do your homework before you buy.  Word to the wise folks!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40EH5000 40-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Weld Tech
Reviews.Content: I give it a 3.5 star due to lack of inputs, mainly. ANY new, modern TV should have at least 3 HDMI inputs (cable / sat, PS3 / Xbox360 / Bluray)...HELLO!!!My 6 year old Westinghouse 27 inch LCD died. Off to Paul's TV (not recommended due to restock fee of 15%), bought this Samsung UN40EH5000 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV. YAY!!I need more HDMI and other inputs too. I'm using Uverse connected to 1 HDMI input (they claim to broadcast HD in 1080p). I connected my WD Media player into the other HDMI input.Since my old xbox360 is component, and my Wii is composite, I'm stuck with only one of those to be connected at one time. My bluray player cannot be connected either, since I've used both HDMI inputs. And..lastly, my Laser disk (yes indeed, still have it) cannot be connected for it's component or composite needs. And..that VHS / DVD combo..composite and or Super Video!!! *sigh* I had all these connections on my cheesy Westinghouse LCD.The smaller the TV, the better it looks...mostly. Comparing this 40 inch to my old 27 inch may not be a fair comparison, even though its...720p vs 1080p / 6 year old technology vs 2012 / LCD vs LED, 1000 contrast ratio vs 3.5 million contrast ratio!The WD player's 1080p and 720p files look great on this TV (still, the "flatness" seems evident), but the "motion blurriness" seen with the Uverse cable seems non existent when playing the media files. Even the bluray movie playing as a demo at the store (Megamind) looked a bit flat, but non blurred when fast motion was playing. I thought it was just the environment / lack of video tweaking but low and behold, it seems not for the flatness aspect.PROS:Less current draw, less heat output than the older LCD TVs.Remote has a light for it's buttons.Remote can control my computer's Samsung Syncmaster 2333HD display (but is a battle for me, when I DON'T want that TV on!!)Speakers are way better (sound is better) than I thought it would be, has 5 band EQ for manually tweaking sound too.Optical output for audio.BLACK is VERY BLACK, White is very white. LOTS of settings to choose from, though it seems many are subtle on what your seeing when tweaked.Has coaxial input for antenna.Claims to be able to play various video formats (avi, mkv) from a USB memory stick only (non USB Hard drive compatible).TV is light enough to carry from room to room if needed. Seems to weigh less than my old 27 inch LCD.CONS:Picture color seems flat, compared to my cheesy old LCD TV or my Syncmaster 2333HD, with "out of box" settings. Tweaking them did help, but I'm still trying to get "brighter" color from this TV.When viewing from a slight angle, not directly in front of TV, fast motion seems blurred a bit (I see less of that when viewing directly from the front). Never had that with my cheesy 27inch Westinghouse LCD. Still shots or slow moving movies, the picture does look great, but still not as bright as I'd seen other TVs produce. I even enabled the LED Motion (or whatever it's called, for just that purpose, fast motion flix to help blurring).NOT NEAR ENOUGH INPUTS. Only has 2 HDMI, 1 shared composite / component (the Y input of the component inputs doubles as the composite input = LAME). No more Wii for Mee.Has analog audio output but not too sure if I can control it's volume..yet (other review states cannot do so with the 32 inch version of this TV).No PC (VGA) or DVI Input.Has USB input but does not support Hard Drives, only thumb drives / flash drives.Conclusion:For 677 USD, too pricy for too little. This baby should be 500 to 550 tops (only based on other TVs pricing for what's offered). A good HDMI splitter can cost 150 USD easy (I have a 40 dollar special) and it can cause "special" anomalies too!Look around before purchasing this TV. Ensure that you can return it if desired, for at least a test run at your home.Even if tweaked properly to get brighter picture, I'm still in a holding pattern for the motion blur and lack of inputs, but I'm probably going to return it, take a 15 percent restock hit and go with the Panasonic TC-L42E50 or ET5. Lots of inputs on that E50 and great picture (when I saw it last year in a store).*** *** *** *** UPDATED FEEDBACK:I changed the HDMI cable I was originally using (was a monster cable, gold contacts, 12 foot - paid around 70.00 for this 5 years ago). The new HDMI cable I used was a no name brand, gold contact 3D ready (1440p rather than the usual 1080p) and was only 15.00 USD!This made a huge difference in the video quality. More deeper colors, much less distortion (blocky) screen when fast moving video was playing (although it was still present) but not too disturbing or much of a let down.On a budget, get this TV. It does look great. Lack of inputs can be combated with the 135.00 splitter, which you could get later. The motion blurriness I've seen is minimal.Unfortunately , I still cannot raise the rating to 4 or 5 due to the lack of inputs. This is a HUGE issue for me. Amazon does have a $135.00 various input splitter device (2 composite, 2 component, 3 HDMI that's 3D ready, and 1 VGA) all can output to 1 HDMI (it's called the ViewHD Multi-functional HDMI Converter Switch). People are rating it very good too. With the cost of this TV at near 680.00 plus the 135.00 for the splitter, your near 800.00 USD. Might as well shell the extra 50 to 100 for a TV that would most likely - possibly, hopefully - have the inputs you require , a higher Hz refresh rate and possibly 3D too. Just watch the "combo composite / component" input thing. Many new TV's do this now (sharing the composite input with the component, even that Panasonic TC-L42E50 / ET5 I was going to get has that combo input. *sigh*I ended up returning my EH5000 (no 15% restock fee due to less than 10 days!), for a Samsung UN46ES7500FXZA (yes, at 1800.00 lots more $$$, but lots more TV too). Awesome TV in fact.

Reviews.Title: SO FAR -SO GOOD
Reviews.Author: Ellen  Fischer
Reviews.Content: ONLY HAD IT A MONTH BUT PICTURE SOUND QUALITY ARE VERY GOOD AND IT WAS EASY TO SET UP.  DELIVERY ON TIME. NO COMPLAINTS SO FAR

Reviews.Title: Great picture descent sound.
Reviews.Author: Keith S.
Reviews.Content: Without much research I asked my wife to purchase this tv for my birthday. While waiting for it to arrive I did a little research and discovered the panel lottery situation. This caused me some concern. When it arrived I wound up with the UF04 version not mentioned in any of the reviews listed here.The reason I wanted a Samsung is we have and older 52" model in our living room that has been a fantastic tv. Out of the box the picture was ok but after adjustment I was able to produce an image equal to or better than the older model.Picture quality is always subjective with any model or make. Room lighting conditions, viewer preference and vision among other things come into play. That is why you need to consider adjustment ability when considering the purchase. This particular model provides enough control that you should be able to get an acceptable image. It also has three modes to allow for changes in viewing conditions. What looks good during the daylight hours may bet too bright during low level lighting.As to the panel lottery. After more research I may have gotten lucky and received a Samsung panel. So I have no reference point to comment on other versions. The only thing I have noticed is a somewhat narrow field of view and some shadowing in the corners. In my opinion this set produces a better image than the edge lit models.I didn't want a smart tv. There are cheaper and better add ons like Roku and Apple TV to provide that technology. I receive my local channels via antenna with good results.All things considered I think this model provides a good value. If you get the version I have you should be very pleased with your purchase. Best of luck if you decide to give this model a chance.

Reviews.Title: TV warranty
Reviews.Author: Michael McCourry
Reviews.Content: This TV arrived broken and amazon replaced right away. About a year and a half later there was a vertical red line on the right side about 6 inches in from the edge. I had bought a warranty from SquareTrade and it was absolutely of no use, what a waste of money.  After taking it to an repair shop, I am told that it may not be fixable.

Reviews.Title: Great quality television (picked by consumer reports)
Reviews.Author: Midwestern Mommy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter because it was recommended in Consumer reports and I did not want to spend time shopping around. Of course Amazon had the best price so it was easy to choose. Very happy with picture quality. Perfect size for a bedroom or dorm.

Reviews.Title: Crossed fingers and toes
Reviews.Author: Saluki "saluki"
Reviews.Content: I feel like I'm rolling the dice here......My Samsung LN-S2651D was suffering from the click of death and after a year of suffering through hours of trying to get it to turn on only to have it turn off again i swore I'd never buy another Samsung and possibly be looking forward to more bad capacitor issues at a future date.  Oh yes, from now on only a Panny or Sony.... but Panasonic in my size and price range seemed to be few and far between.  And the Sony in this price range was described as "jack of all trades master of none."In truth, I kept looking at Vizio's and LG's but the picture was so much better on the Samsung......So I bought it.  And it's a lovely TV.I used the calibrations posted by bareyb and it was spot on.......Beautiful picture........I did dock it one star mainly for one reason.......There is no DVI connection....... I have an older Oppo OPDV971H dvd player which I cannot connect.  My Oppo has no HDMI ......and although I could use a DVI to HDMI adaptor I still needed a DVI input for the audio which the Samsung does not have on this TV.  So, I have no way to connect this, and as a result I have no way of viewing my foreign region dvds........So right now I'm using Netgear Push2TV to view DVD's from my computer on the TV....... I have a Roku connected as well..........Well, that uses up my 2 HDMI's on the TVVerizon has me connect the cable through the component connectionwhich they say give the best picture......Other minor quibbles....Assembling the stand seemed to have it slightly angling down, ---managed to straighten it out but it has alot of give sitting on the base.Instructions leave much to be desired---three or so little pieces of paper.........The picture is great when you are viewing straight on but if you are viewing from more than a modest angle the colors fade.  Not a problem for me as it is a bedroom TV and I only have it at a slight angle and there is no problem viewing it at a reclining position....Incidentally, I have version:  UU02 and I'm pretty sure from other forums that it's a Samsung Panel... excellent picture!It also has much better sound than my previous Samsung......I haven't noticed any problems with motion.I do love the TV, so I'm giving Samsung another chance.......Now, I'm going to get a soldering gun and take apart the other Samsung and hope I don't electrocute myself ;) Lol

Reviews.Title: Good size
Reviews.Author: GB
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 32" TV for my office and decided on this Samsung. Great TV after getting it set up. Instructions where not very good and it took me close to an hour to get the channels downloaded from the cable company along with the proper settings. Once completed it looks terrific. Be prepared to spend time to get it to your liking.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little LCD, led tv
Reviews.Author: Wayne W. "70Cyclone"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for the kitchen.  Put it on a swivel wall mount so my wife could see it anywhere within the kitchen.  The picture is excellent.  They have come so far with these TV's and for a very reasonable price.  I was one of the first people to jump into the HD plasma TV scene back in the early 2000's.  I had purchased 60 inch top of the line Sony plasma for over $12,000.  I can't even imagine that.  Now look at the prices.  Oh, the Sony has been passed on for a needy cause, but I can say that this little Samsung has a far superior picture than that old Sony.

Reviews.Title: Solid
Reviews.Author: N. Swanson
Reviews.Content: This is our second Samsung LCD HDTV and we got exactly what we're looking for. The picture quality meets our expectations of a Samsung product. It's a great bedroom TV. It was easy to set up, and with the use of the Disney WOW HD setup DVD I got the picture looking great.I chose this model because it is not a Smart TV. I don't need the wireless capabilities nor do I need the additional software as I use a Roku with this TV. I'd recommend it for others who do the same thing. There is no reason to spend additional money for features that you will not use.All in all this was just what I was looking for and am very happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: LOVE This TV
Reviews.Author: David P McMurray
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  The picture, sound and size are perfect.  Keep in mind that the stand does not swivel.  I am purchasing a Lazy Susan to make it easier to adjust the viewing angle.

Reviews.Title: This is my 3rd one, I love this TV
Reviews.Author: N. Miller "Passt"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these in 2012 to use as my PC monitor and I love it.  I just bought two more to set up a 3 monitor setup for the racing simulator I play.  These things have a nice thin border around the screen, which I like.The only tip I can offer is that if you're using this for a monitor, the screen won't look clear unless you put the picture setup on MOVIE mode.  Standard and the other option make the desktop look blurry.  Not really a big dea, just a tip.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: mcs "marycaryny"
Reviews.Content: I have yet to find a flaw with this TV. Crisp picture, quick transitions between channels, good sound quality. Can't go wrong for the price.

Reviews.Title: Happy to finally get updated electronics!
Reviews.Author: Bandit
Reviews.Content: Very happy with first flat screen I've owned. Replaced 20 year old tv that died. Great picture! Wow-what a difference! Works wonderfully for my master bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Great TV. I bought it for my mom. What a beautiful picture. Easy to operate and if it weren't for her but for me I would have spent 29 more bucks and gotten the smart one, but this was perfect for her

Reviews.Title: Very Good Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Since there are many settings for audio and picture quality, it might take some experimenting to come up with the perfect settings for people with different tastes and needs, but I like that this TV's settings are so customizable and appreciate the quality of both picture and sound. The colors are excellent.I also like putting my movies onto a USB flash drive, plugging the flash drive into the TV, and being able to watch the movies directly from the drive.The 32 inch size is great for my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5000 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: edm40 "edm40"
Reviews.Content: Very hesitant ordering a TV online. I have ordered electronics from Amazon before and from amazon warehouse deals and have had great luck. TV arrived very quickly, i think it was only two days and in good condition. First worry out of the way. Everything seemed to be in order inside the box. Installation was easy. I trust Samsung, and already have a 46". Great picture. Works great with son's xbox. Was not sure if the 60 Hz was going to be an issue. It is not an issue. Sharp picture, great color, good sound, great price. So far so good. Two thumbs up. I bought the HDMI cable through amazon also they work great together.

Reviews.Title: Well Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Rickc85
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time.  Setup was immediate.  Worked as well or better than expected.Score another win for Samsung and Amazon, both.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture. No light leaks.
Reviews.Author: P. Barnett
Reviews.Content: Unpacking and assembly was simple and involved mounting the stand to the TV with 8 small screws. After about 10 minutes of doing that and stripping the protective coating, I got batteries in the remote and hit the power button. I was greeted with the picture from my Roku which was outstanding, but was only outputting 720p. Even at that setting, it looked great. A quick trip into the menu of the Roku had it running at 1080p, which was really outstanding.We spent the next 6 hours watching various programs. Splendid detail in the pictures. 1080p content was crisp and sharp.I observed no light leaks from the cabinet. Totally dark.Even though I'm an electronics maven, I'm not going into the details. It's a great TV for a low price and it does everything I wanted with no drawbacks I can see. Color me satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Good value HDTV, not many extras / features
Reviews.Author: J. A. Quayle
Reviews.Content: If you just want a HDTV, and leave the smarts in the devices that connect to it, then this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Good HD monitor solution
Reviews.Author: yk "yk"
Reviews.Content: Operation is complex enough that I had to follow instructions to make it work with my computer.  I used to use CRT monitor, so this is a big improvement to my deteriorating eyes.

Reviews.Title: Lookin' good...
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: Have only had it up and running for 2 days...but here are my impressions.  Picture seems good to me...actually the detail from the HD stations is a little hard to adjust to after having a CRT with converter box...I keep getting distracted by all the details in the backgrounds.  One thing I notice is that the tuner pulls in more stations than the 2 converter boxes I was using (alternately) with the other CRT TV.  I am using an antenna with the stations being  from 20 to 70 miles away.  I had to custom mount the TV in an "entertainment center" so that the front edge of the TV is in front of the front of the center...stand is screwed down at the back of the pedestal.  A 32" is about the minimum size to get the 1080 DPI?  Still adjusting the picture...I'd recommend just messing around till you get something you can live with...since I have a variety of DPI signals...400s up to 1080...it's a compromise.  One issue is that you will need to keep video other than full screen down to a minimum in order to avoid "burn-in".  Version is UU02.  I see no issues with viewing angle and so forth.

Reviews.Title: Clear picture and sound
Reviews.Author: fergie
Reviews.Content: This TV is just the right size for me. The picture is clear the sound is out of this world! I would recommend this TV to anyone.Easy no hassle setup after delivery.

Reviews.Title: A TV for brightly lit rooms.
Reviews.Author: Tom Hanley
Reviews.Content: My interest in this LCD-TV stemmed from a very positive Consumer Report review. One of the convincing factors was that our TV would be placed in a well lit room during daylight hours. Ultimately the best price for this Samsung was from Amazon.com.  The product could be delivered in time for Christmas 2013 as well.This was my first LCD purchase. We had a 52" Samsung plasma screen TV for seven years.The delivery service was routine and the installation was quick and easy.  After two months use the family is quite pleased with the Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: love the picture
Reviews.Author: four4camping
Reviews.Content: We love love love the picture quality and the price we got was awesome too!  Shipped just in time for super bowl party.  The free support from Amazon was a bonus and the screws from our existing mount didn't work and nothing in the paperwork said what to use so they were able to get us the info to buy the right item.

Reviews.Title: Could not be better!
Reviews.Author: Shopper
Reviews.Content: I love my new TV! It has a great picture and sounds really good. Bought this for a workout room and added Apple TV to it and all works really well.

Reviews.Title: Samsung is OUTSTANDING
Reviews.Author: John R.Licari
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv for my aging father.  He doesn't have to squint any longer looking at an outdated tv.  This was a wonderful addition to his tv sitting room. Directly over the fireplace, bright screen and an absolute treasure...He loves it, and that makes me happy! You will definitely not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be Happier
Reviews.Author: mary mclellan
Reviews.Content: The price was extremely reasonable, the TV was delivered as promised, unpacked easily with simple, easy to follow setup directions and screws included.  Within 20 minutes I had my new TV setup, hooked-up to cable and was watching my favorite shows! I've had the TV about three months and I couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Great Value TV
Reviews.Author: D MCG
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV a few months ago and absolutely love it. I have it connected to an Apple TV and it does a great job on the HD content on Netflix etc, super clear. With a bit of adjusting to the default color settings it turns out a great, super sharp image. For under 300 bucks it's an impressive bit of kit at a practical size.(My TV is UU02 version - so a Samsung panel.)

Reviews.Title: Wonderful purchase!
Reviews.Author: E. Passonno "vlietian"
Reviews.Content: Easy initial set-up of TV.  Much clearer picture and sound than previous models.  I have already recommended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Works Great easy to set up
Reviews.Author: George Simpson
Reviews.Content: I would reccommend this product to anyone. Saw it originally in the Consumer Report Review and the review was right on. I actually bought a "used" one. The set up was so easy

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Jorge
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on Cyber Monday with a huge discounted price. I love the TV however i think there is some drawbacks. When installing the television with the stand that it came with, i feel like the Tv is really wobbly. The TV is huge and the stand is really small. But i mean the TV is still in good working order, but i am very careful on how I move it.

Reviews.Title: Picture Good But Not Great
Reviews.Author: Barry
Reviews.Content: Picture is fairly good, but not perfect.  May be Time Warner signal, rather than TV.  Have not figured out yet.  Only had the set for 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV but has volume issues
Reviews.Author: Pat Gigstead
Reviews.Content: The picture on the TV is good but the volume could be louder.  May have to consider adding a speaker system.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Gregg J Anderson
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality. Definitely a great buy. Perfect for a living room & Apply TV. or Roku. Good buy for us.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful colors but moving pictures are average
Reviews.Author: R. Upadhyay
Reviews.Content: Colors are beautiful and amazing. Moving images are not that great. I could see some grainy background which become clear when motion stops. For example, while watching a football game, I focus on the green field rather on the moving players. I see some graininess on the green. When the players stop and the camera stops, picture becomes clear.

Reviews.Title: Great TV if you can get the right price
Reviews.Author: J Collins
Reviews.Content: The TV has a great picture and works great. The only problem I had was there is only 1 component input (or rca jack) and several HDMI inputs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture
Reviews.Author: Joshua R.
Reviews.Content: This tv has excellent picture. The sound is fantastic for the included speaker. I have only had it a a week now but I have no complaints. I am a movie addict so it has already gotten quite a bit of use

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Alex Walex
Reviews.Content: No technical issues so far. Love the color, the sound is great, and so was the price. The kids love playing their video games on this !!As stated in other reviews, you have to fiddle with the settings to get it just right, but that took all of two minutes to find something that looks great for us.Delivery was a few days late, but I've come to expect that during the holiday crunch.Totally satisfied with this television, and would recommend it for those on a budget looking to upgrade either size or picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Just Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Sandi Cather
Reviews.Content: We ordered this Samsung 46" t.v. because we needed a bigger t.v. for our lower level. The price with Amazon was phenomenal and the shipping was very reasonable ($16 I think).  It came very quickly. Was easy to set up and start to watch right away. The size is perfect. The picture is excellent.  I had been shopping t.v.'s and prices and when I saw this and so I went online and ordered it. We are very happy with this purchase. I would highly recommend buying this Samsung 46" t.v. from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Richard M.Rice
Reviews.Content: Very good TV. Got this one for our conference room.  It does have two draw backs the refresh is only 60hz. 120hz would be better. It only has 2 HDMI ports. Everything is going to HDMI cables it could use 2 more in my opinion.  For the price it's a good tv.

Reviews.Title: quality
Reviews.Author: diego
Reviews.Content: The Television is exactly what I wanted and received it is now in my room where I can see clear picture of shows and games like NFL and Soccer

Reviews.Title: Version #?
Reviews.Author: Preston
Reviews.Content: Ok i am decently happy with my 32" LED 720p 60hz Samsung tv but i was wondering if it is one of the actual samsung TVs through and through? I saw one review that answered that question but i guess it was older so it didnt have the full list of version codes... Mine is a TD05 and that wasn't listed at all. If you no the full list of version codes and what screans go with what codes please put a list of them on here thats all i really want to no unless someone can put a more simple set of directions up for how to set up the tv with sound and black LVL and all of that. That would be very helpful but all around its not a bad tv either way. I just wish everyone would stop being so cheap and make their products with good material and good craftsman ship like companies used to pride themselves on. Not who can make it the cheapest and make them the most profit! Thank you

Reviews.Title: Damaged when I received it.
Reviews.Author: cadguy49
Reviews.Content: Hard to rate this one in particular because it was damaged when I received it.  I don't know why the television manufacturers don't do more to protect their product.  The boxes these televisions come in are flimsy.  They at least need to better protect the screen, which is very vulnerable in these boxes.  I have always liked Samsung products and I'm sure this is at least a decent TV.  However I will never know for sure because they were out of stock when I tried to exchange the damaged one.  Stuff happens!!

Reviews.Title: Does everything as advertised
Reviews.Author: A School Teacher
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Only flaw I could find is weak sound, easily remedied with a budget pair of computer speakers. Very prompt delivery (free). Good job, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: On the fence
Reviews.Author: Smac
Reviews.Content: For a Samsung, it doesn't have the best color. I tried the settings mentioned in other reviews, but I am still not pleased. I am considering returning.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V.  for the price.
