Reviews.Author: Fishing "Harv"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a huge Sony flat screen tube type.  It was a good t.v. for the time, but this is so much better.  It's a lot less expensive to operate and I was able to get a larger t.v. than I had.  So far I am very happy with it.  I tweaked the settings a little, but could have used the settings it came with.  I would recommend this t.v. to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for at a great price
Reviews.Author: Bryan Vandergriff
Reviews.Content: It arrived exactly when it was supposed to and the delivery driver even helped bring the box inside.  TV is everything I hoped for at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I liked theis TV because it has many ports for inputs on it. @ HDMI Ports makes it especially nice for switching from cable TV to PC and back. It also has the external RCA Ports for surround sound add on. Not to mention a picture that is awesome and hadr to believe after watching regular TV's for such a long time. It looks like you can reach right into it, it is so clear.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT CHRISTMAS GIFT
Reviews.Author: hrg "hrg"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift, and the recipient is extremely happy with it. It's a beautiful set. The color is very good. The delivery / packaging, was without incident. The price was comparable to like brands & in some cases, better. This set will offer years of great viewing. I'm glad we got it..and we did a lot of research before making this choice.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Was exactly what I was looking for. Nice picture and good sound! Was rated highly in Consumer Reports especially for sound!

Reviews.Title: I love love LOVE this TV!
Reviews.Author: Timothy P. Lyons
Reviews.Content: When I was in the market for a new TV I knew I wanted a few things... it had to be a 32" Samsung LED with 1080p resolution. I was torn between the UN32EH5000, 5300, and 6300 models. A quick rundown: The 5000 is a 60Hz model without Smart TV, the 5300 adds Smart TV options, and the 6300 introduces a 120Hz refresh rate. Since this would primarily be used for console gaming, the 60Hz would be more than plenty. Also since my Xbox One had all the Smart TV features, the 5300 series would be more expensive.So before buying, ask yourself do you need the 120Hz refresh rate? Do you need Smart TV? If not, save a few bucks and get the 5000 series Samsung TV! I couldn't be happier with mine.

Reviews.Title: Love Samsung.
Reviews.Author: Donna Mac
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV at local retailer about three weeks ago and so far I'm over the top happy with it. Beautiful picture and I don't even have HD. Really easy to set up and the LED size is great. I don't think I'll ever purchase anything but Samsung from now on.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised!
Reviews.Author: BritBrat84
Reviews.Content: I literally got my TV today 12/6/13, its been on about 4 hours now & I am surprised by the excellent picture & sound quality. Now I'm no techie or anything like that so my rating is purely based on #1. picture quality, 2. sound quality & 3. ease of use. Based on that alone, which is all I know about TVs, I'm giving it 5 stars. Now if it just completely breaks down on me then I'll update this but so far, this tv is just that good!I was a little weary based on another reviewers explanation of the Samsung panels, mine says its the UU02 version & I'm still not sure if Samsung actually makes this but honestly, who cares? if it looks & sounds as good as this, it was well worth the price.I did do some tweaking of the factory settings, I used the settings another reviewer posted & it looks great. &OMG; the sound quality was another pleasant surprise!! I was prepared to buy some external speakers or sound bar but not anymore. The sound is so rich, the bass is deep & the surround sound is true to its name. I have a 46 in. Sharp Aquos in my living room & its sound quality is terrible,  not even close to my new 32in Samsung :)**Just a note...I'm using the HDMI cable connection with my AT&T; UVERSE HD service. AT&T; gives me a 1080p option, so I chose that & it definitely makes this picture amazingly crisp & clear.

Reviews.Title: Too much for too little
Reviews.Author: C M D
Reviews.Content: This is probably as basic as a LED TV your going to get.  Walmart is selling the same model on line for $479,  the prices are dropping.  This is only a 60Hz model, good enough for regular TV but with HDMI I believe you will do better spending the extra $75 or so and getting a true 120Hz model.  The sound is just not there, quality is non existent.  Why doesn't this TV have a RJ45 port for internet at this price as other Samsungs?  I returned it and purchased the Smart TV version and it was the best $75 dollars I paid.  Walmart had no problem at all exchanging it for me.

Reviews.Title: This TV at this price and quality? YOU BET, I'M HAPPY!
Reviews.Author: Joanna Daneman
Reviews.Content: Comes in a flat box, not terribly heavy at 21lbs. The TV is somewhat less heavy. I did not have trouble lifting it but it's a bit wide. They suggest two people but you really can lift it with one if you are careful.It comes with plastic protection on the black bezel but NONE on the screen. I kept telling a friend who was helping me install it NOT to put it face down and was told, in a superior tone that I was being silly but I had noticed there was no peel-off membrane on the glass.The instructions are minimal and consist of two sheets: one to screw together the stand (a matter of 8 screws, four in the base and four to attach the base to the screen back. This is best done face down with something protecting the glass, ie a blanket or the plastic foam.)Set-up: took about five minutes on plug-n-play. Seeks channels from cable or air; we have Verizon FIOS and it works fine with Verizon. However, my FIOS remote needs reprogramming to use one rather than both (TV and FIOS) so that would take longer than five minutes.HDMI: No HDMI cable is included. I happened to have one, so I installed it to the FIOS box. I have to switch it out, or use a second HDMI in the HDMI-2 slot for the Roku.The manual is a thin, folded sheet of paper. Text is a bit small. I prefer PDF manuals anyway, but this is very minimal. Turned out to be all I needed, however.PICTUREThe picture is bright, in fact, on "movie" setting I find it too bright, even in a dim room. (you get standard, movie and dynamic, which adjusts to the light in the room)The picture is clear and not fogged, as in a cheap little digital TV we got at Big Lots. Definitely looks good.Sound: acceptable. For better sound, you'd use a surround-sound or home theater type speaker system.SUMMARYFor a "price that came in under three bills or available from other sellers at a similar price (three and change if you go for the Square Trade warranty) it's great. I'm totally happy. It's easy to use. It was easy on the pocketbook.In a small den, 32" is large enough for comfortable viewing. If your room is large you may want to go up to at least a 40" or best, a 50". The main TV. TV's in the house is the old bulbous, 40 lb monster that Goodwill won't even take anymore, so I guess it was time to bow to the inevitable and change it out to digital flat panel. I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Guy
Reviews.Author: W. Terrell Wiggins
Reviews.Content: Great TV---we use it in the treadmill room. I have owned several Samsung TVs....It does not have 3D(which I did not need)----but is 1080p and has a very good refresh rate....Highly Recommend...

Reviews.Title: Quality TV
Reviews.Author: Lath
Reviews.Content: Picked up this 50" tv at a ridiculous price over labor day.  It is thicker than most led tv's but it went in our master bedroom so that didn't matter. Very basic tv with 2 hdmi inputs, USB, and a shared component/composite input. I'll only be using it with DirecTV and chromecast so the number of inputs is fine. I probably wouldn't put this in the living room given the size and lack of features but it's great for what it is. A basic hdtv with a fantastic picture.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Christine e. Lundy
Reviews.Content: We Love this TV...It is a great TV with awesome picture and great sound system.....I would highly recommend this TV...

Reviews.Title: Perfect.
Reviews.Author: C. J. Dorton
Reviews.Content: It's amazing to see how far display technology has came in just twenty some odd years. I remember the days of floor model 30" CRT televisions that took three grown men to move, now I can get a 46" that weighs 30lbs?!The 46" Samsung I ordered came with a Samsung display panel, not the other random off-brand ones as mentioned by previous posters. Simply put; the image quality is AMAZING, even compared to my relatively new 47" Westinghouse LCD panel. The blacks are so perfect that it looks like part of the screen is actually turned off, though it isn't. If you don't need wifi or all that nonsense I'd suggest picking one of these Samsung LED HDTVs over anything else. (I use it exclusively as a monitor.)

Reviews.Title: trust Amazon reviews
Reviews.Author: knuckles
Reviews.Content: I needed to quickly purchase a 32" flat screen for a bedroom. I narrowed my search down to Samsung as I believe they are the leaders in quality. Amazon reviews lead me to UN32EH5000. Price was fantastic, great picture quality, great sound. Right out of the box settings were fine. Trust Amazon reviews, this was a great purchase without doing much homework.

Reviews.Title: Reviews are accurate
Reviews.Author: mro
Reviews.Content: This tv has everything you'll read about. The sound quality is very good, and the screen is very clean. Using it with a Mac mini so I don't watch tv through cable or satellite. Very happy with purchase

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: AD
Reviews.Content: It was finally time to get rid of the ol' tube TV and I am really pleased with this TV as its replacement. My only complaint is that the auto light sensing and dimming feature is a little more sensitive than I would like it to be--meaning, there are times when I feel like the TV is a tad too dark. But other than that--great buy!

Reviews.Title: The best TV
Reviews.Author: Raymond W. Leung "rwleung98"
Reviews.Content: I brought this for my daughter who moved out to an apartment for school. It doubles up as her computer monitor. It has all the necessary connection for different devices. She can watch TV with her Note II. I got great local channels with just an digital antenna.She uses the TV to connect to her lap top and with a bluetooth mouse/keyboard her lap top became a desk top. It is so light she can move it anywhere. No need to buy those wall hangers it comes with its stand.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: georgine olson
Reviews.Content: Nice TV for the money. the first one had a red line going down the right side of the screen after about 3 days. I sent it back and no problems got a new one and it's worked great!!

Reviews.Title: A Great TV with the great Amazon price!
Reviews.Author: Whomike "Whomike"
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased based on the Consumer Reports rating of "Best Buy". I had no experience with flat screen TV's at all. All my TV's were old Cathode ray tube type.This was my first HD flat screen. I am glad I bought this one. Consumer Reports did not lead me astray. Everything Samsung says in the product literature is true. I like this TV so much that I bought another Samsung (in the same series)- a 46" inch for my family room.Consumer Reports said that "smart internet connected TV's" do not work like you would expect or want ( they do not work like a computer connected to the internet) and sometimes have problems. This one is not a "smart" TV but it works just like a TV should! For the great Amazon price this is a "Best Buy" for me!

Reviews.Title: Amazing television for such low cost!!!
Reviews.Author: LizChamplin
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to buy a purchase so large on the Internet since I usually would buy such things in store, but this deal was too good to pass up.  I bought a repackaged version but the TV was brand new and a nice upgrade from my 22 inch television. After searching for about a week and doing research I couldn't stop coming back to this TV. 40 inch, under $400.00, and a trustworthy brand such as Samsung. The setup was incredibly easy, and the finished product is wonderful. This TV is all screen which I am a fan of and it is very slim and not bulky whatsoever. The quality of anything I watch is wonderful even if it is a non-HD channel. I am no tech guru, and did have to research a lot about televisions and brands in general but I know what I like. Overall I see absolutely no faults in this television at all. I am outrageously happy with my purchase and my crystal clear and vibrant television. I recommend this samsung to anyone on a budget and wanting a bigger tv experience for their living room like me, and trust me you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: Simple But Elegant
Reviews.Author: BRADLEY CLAYTON
Reviews.Content: This TV is great for the nice screen and cable hook ups.You don't have to pay for the SMART TV. I just use a Apple TV to make it "smart". You save money that way.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: SB
Reviews.Content: Good price for a 50 inch samsung tv. Display looks great. Sound on the tv is awesome! I would def recommend purchasing this TV at under $700.

Reviews.Title: Very nice.
Reviews.Author: familygirl
Reviews.Content: I wanted a the largest possible screen that would fit into the opening in my traditional style entertainment center.  The opening is just "39 3/4 wide, so my choices were limited.  With the very narrow frame around the screen on this TV, it was an exact match for the width.  Any other brand of TV that I saw had much wider frame, so the screen size to fit into this opening was 37inches at the largest.  Not a big difference, but to find one that fits and have the bonus be that it's a Samsung is great.  I posted a photo of how it fits perfectly into the entertainment center.It was very simple to hook up. Just wish HDMI cables came with these things!

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: Shopper
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 40" version of this TV a year ago and decided to move that one from the family room to the master bedroom and buy a 46" version for the family room.These TVs are in our summer house, where we don't want/need more than a good TV. This fits the bill, and for the price, I don't think you can find a better one. I could easily watch these year-round.The 40" supposedly has the Sharp screen, and the 46" the Samsung one. I really can't tell a difference. The alarming reviews about the difference between Sharp and Samsung mostly talk about the Sharp being worth $100 less than the Samsung. I simply could not find another TV the same size for $100 less than I paid for this one. Plus, if you are not satisfied with the pre-set picture options, there are plenty of ways to customize the picture.Similarly, the sound can be customized in a number of different ways. And, though while not home theater-quality surround sound (something we have in our home theater at our main house), the sound on this TV is really quite good. No need for a sound bar to make up for any short-comings.

Reviews.Title: best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: iKnowJack
Reviews.Content: Great contrast.A little on the thick side, but that's because it is a true back-lit LED panel. Most, if not all slim line panels are side-lit LED.Good sound and volume.

Reviews.Title: 40 inch
Reviews.Author: Smakdaddy
Reviews.Content: Nice tv. Speakers are not that great. We have it in our bedroom and it sets about 12' from us. We have to keep the volume nearly full to hear the words that are spoken softly in movies. Whispers we cannot hear at all.

Reviews.Title: My TV
Reviews.Author: Lighthouse Voc Ed Center
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my tv but I am not a good recommendation if you are a true connoisseur or really know anything about tv's but if you just want a good tv to watch this is a great tv

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: AlkoKato
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box, performed well.  Simple menu and controls to learn.My only disappointment is that I did order a 120Hz set, which I believewould have minimized movement is some parts of the picture.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5000 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Sae-Il Murtada
Reviews.Content: I have had the TV now for about 3 months and must say I am pleased with it. I have it in the livingroom but I would think it is more suitable as a bedroom TV due to the size. I dont have any HD-channels and actually I think a larger non-HD TV for the same price could have been better. For the PS3 it looks really good and I forget its small screen size pretty fast.Clean design and good settings menu as most Samsung products.The only thing I can complain on with the TV which I removed a star for is that the HDMI is located on the side. Very weird and annoying that the HDMI wire is visible from the side and also slightly from the front... I dont understand why they didnt place it at the back where the cable wire goes...Great and fast delivery from Amazon as usual.

Reviews.Title: Samsung disappoints
Reviews.Author: Matisyahu "Matisyahu"
Reviews.Content: Wide variations in color and fading when viewed at not much of an angle disappoints us compared to our 4 year old Samsung DLP set.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Kate Henry
Reviews.Content: Great price; greater TV. Right out of the box it was perfect. I highly recommend this television; you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: picture quality sub-par for a Samsung
Reviews.Author: robyrob
Reviews.Content: this Samsung was really my second choice for an LED tv, after they delivered a no-name brand TV instead of the Toshiba I ordered and then told me that the Toshiba model was no longer available from Amazon(yet strangely still available at all of the other sellers) so i was not as sure about this model as I would have like to be. Still, i have purchased many other Samsung products in the past with pretty good results.My version code is the HS03, when i compare it to our LG 47LW5300 or Toshiba 32' LCD, the quality is nowhere near as good - colors are washed out and very dark, but I have given up trying to adjust it in the two weeks I have owned it. There are a number of white spots on the screen that don't seem to go away and are very distracting in dark scenes or where they appear in the borders when there are black bars on the sides of the screen.Overall, I have not been very pleased with this purchase - i honestly had a better picture out of the 12-year old Toshiba 37" CRT that it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: R. Hodge "NC Wineman"
Reviews.Content: We had purchased the model 5300 Smart TV for our master bedroom, and liked it so much we bought this 5300 for in-laws to replace a 7 year old Sharp that was beginning to display 'waterfall' streaks on the LED display. We specifically chose the 5300 since they did not need all the bells and whistles that come on the Smart model (they don't have a broadband connection. Unfortunately, they have a standard definition satellite box, so they are not getting the display of which the 5000 is capable. They may be upgrading to a hi-def satellite box for improved picture. However, even with standard def input, this is a very nice set that meets their needs.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Willem Schira
Reviews.Content: I got lucky and got one of the good panels.  I use this as my main display for my laptop, and I haven't had a single problem in the past six months.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Ontime Delivery
Reviews.Author: Hank Anderson
Reviews.Content: Ordered TV after reading an online review much like this one. Received TV as they promised on the date promised. Had to re-set some of the settings as recommended by a reviewer, and picture is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular!
Reviews.Author: Daniel S. Levy "Daniel in SB"
Reviews.Content: Was circumspect when ordering this HDTV, as I was planing to use it as a computer monitor, and some of the reviews were less than ideal. After using the Windows 8 calibration utility to improve the color balance, I'm absolutely blown away! Will NEVER go back to a small monitor again! One of the absolute best upgrades I've ever done!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: jack_splat58
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV because it was LED, 1080p and had a QAM tuner.  We don't do any gaming, so the 60hz was ok.  The LED will save us $$ and so does the QAM tuner.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Alexis V
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my parents, they loved it so far. It seemed smaller than a 40" TV, but I realized that was because the bezel was so small compared to my old TV (which had like 1 1/2 Inch Bezel).

Reviews.Title: Buy 2 and use them as computer monitors
Reviews.Author: Andrew M. Dillow
Reviews.Content: I have purchased two of these and use them as computer monitors. I have a high-end video graphics card Radeon 6990HD that allows me to span games across both screens (eyefinity mode) in effect that gives me 64" of gaming real estate which is nice but if your planning on doing this you may want to mount the monitors on the wall at least 4 feet away from you 64" is just too big to follow right in your face.Using the right monitor to browse the internet and the left monitor to run programs works very well to.I had read that text while using a LED TV as a monitor might look blurry but let me put this rumor to rest text looks amazing as well as the picture while playing games watching youtube video's etc.With the price drop on Amazon for just at 700.00 you can get both monitors and with the free shipping this is a steal. Compare this to what Dell sells a 30" monitor for and you are getting your set up for less than the price of 1 30" monitor.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture!
Reviews.Author: Tina M. Meeks
Reviews.Content: I went to Consumer Reports in helping to select a new television. They did not steer me wrong. I got all I wanted with this Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Great picture for the form factor; lacks a few connections
Reviews.Author: Roger J Stierman
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV because it was the largest 1080p screen that would fit in our existing TV cabinet (30.3" max. width).  Picture superb,use it for broadcast stations (not cable or satellite) .  Tuner not as sensitive as some others, and it shares one RCA-jack input between the Composite In and Component In, so I have to accept lower resolution from my DVD/VCR combo.Would like to see all TVs' specs include tuner sensitivity, usually expressed as a microvolts/noise figure.  Many of us despise cable/satellite.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Tammy Bowers
Reviews.Content: We have found this TV to meet all our expectations and more...would highly recommend it and would purchase it all over again.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Billy Z Lin
Reviews.Content: The display is very vivid, easy to use controls, and very light.  All in all, I would recommend it for others as well for an LED screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price.
Reviews.Author: Frank H
Reviews.Content: Easy, simple and quick installation.  Superb picture and surpisingly good sound for a LCD flat screen.  Good selection and location of connections.  So far, very happy with product.Last TV was a 32" Panasonic Tau flat CRT 720i.  This Samsung 40" 1080p is a wonderful upgrade.Update:  After two days of trying to get the picture as good as it was in the store, I found the problem; PEBKAC.  The TV was set perfectly for 1080p/16x9 but my Blu Ray player was still set to 720i/4x3.  DOH!  After I noticed this user error and changed my BD player to 1080p/16x9, WOW.  Almost like getting two upgrades in one order.In short, if the TV does not seem to be displaying as high a resolution as you expected, double check your source settings.

Reviews.Title: Perfection Out of the Box
Reviews.Author: Sky
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Samsung PN50A550S 50-inch 1080p Plasma HDTV for several years and it's the best TV that I've ever owned. So when I finally decided to upgrade the master bedroom TV another Samsung was the clear choice.Importantly, the picture is magnificent on the Samsung UN32EH5000 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV. Right out of the box the default settings needed no adjustment. I'm sure over time I will indeed play around with some of the settings, but for the simple purposes of connecting just cable TV using an HDMI connection the TV was basically plug and play.The TV comes with a stand that requires very simple assembly:  First you connect the base of the stand to the mount of the stand with 4 screws; then you connect the assembled stand to the TV with the turn of 4 screws; and that is the only real "work" that you'll have to do to get the set up.I was curious as to whether the LCD picture on my new 32-inch would be as vivid and defining as my 50-inch plasma. I guess since I've always had a plasma TV I've convinced myself that there is nothing better. But I'm not gonna lie...the argument for plasma versus LCD (in my mind) has weakened significantly at least as far as cable TV goes. I am just as impressed with the high-def that is served by the 32-inch LCD as I am with the 50-inch plasma that I've gotten used to over the years. The highest definition that my cable company (Cablevision) is broadcasting is 1080i, so I can't make any comparisons to the brilliant 1080p picture quality that I get from Blu Ray on the 50-inch.You can set the 32-inch Samsung's picture to Standard (for a TV placed in a normal environment), Movie (for dark rooms) or Dynamic (for bright rooms). This is the one settings that you'll definitely want to pay attention to and try before you become complacent with the default setting.There are (several) other settings that the factory has pre-set that all look (and sound) great, but you're free to manually adjust just about everything to your own liking. There is an equalizer in the audio settings that you should also adjust to your preference, but to an untrained ear you may never "need" to do anything as far as the sound settings go.If I had to dig--and I mean really dig--for a complaint, it might be that the stand mounts the TV about an inch too low in order to be able to place my cable box on the same shelf as the TV underneath the screen. However, this is a personal thing, because if you're trying to fit the TV into a specific space that only a 32-inch TV will fit into you'll want to know that the exact height of the TV with stand is 19 1/2" and the width is 29". So plan your space for the TV and its accessories accordingly.I am really stoked about my new Samsung 32-inch 1080p LED TV. I couldn't be more satisfied, and I'd highly recommend it to anyone in the market for a TV of this size.

Reviews.Title: I love it.  It is much better than I expected.
Reviews.Author: Shirley Yeager
Reviews.Content: I . needed a new TV for the bedroom.  My husband likes it better than his.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a new TV.have

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: We researched many sources for a TV for our kitchen/dining area of our house.  This one kept getting our attention with the features/benefits scenario.  I ordered it on a Saturday and it arrived on the following Monday.  Could not have been more satisfied with quality.  Great picture, good sound, fits right into our lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves it!
Reviews.Author: sld1111
Reviews.Content: My sister and I gave this set to my mom for Christmas.  She is 86-years-old with vision issues.  She loves the clarity and size of the picture.  In fact, she said it was a perfect gift.

Reviews.Title: Not disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Ernesto Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: For the price and quality the tv is great. The 60Hz / frame rape is noticeable in blacks and with slower frame rate video files. Ie. anime. I use it with mkv file formats and seems to make up for the frame rate. Still waiting on an Xbox for gaming purposes but I am not a full fledge gamer. I mostly watch movies. I went to Costco a day or so ago two weeks after getting the tv we up and felt like the extra money for a 120Hz tv could have been worth the extra 3-4 hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: A good buy for the price
Reviews.Author: Turtleowlman
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have stated, the picture is not great with the factory settings.  But if you take the time to research and calibrate it properly this tv has the capability to have a nice picture.  If you have owned other Samsung tvs this should be no surprise.There are only two things that keep me from a 5 star rating.  First, the tv struggles to go from very dark to bright.  It takes a moment to adjust, which is a bit annoying while gaming.  Secondly, I've notice some ghosting at times.  Turning the brightness down could probably fix those issues but i don't find the issues bad enough to be worth it.It is important to note that these problems are from playing Xbox in 1080P.  If you are just using the tv for movies and television shows the picture is very good.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise.  This was a great price and even though there are other reviews that are not flattering, we honestly didn't expect much.  Surprise, Surprise....  LOVE IT!  Beautiful picture, light and easy to hook up.  NOTE, there are no RCA only 2 HDMI and 1 Component In, so don't expect to connect that old VHS or DVD player to it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic as a monitor!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Gersonde
Reviews.Content: Don't believe anyone who tells you a TV won't make a good monitor! When I hooked my laptop up to this, I couldn't believe the difference in picture quality. There were no text issues at all. Of course, I won the panel lottery and got the TS01 version, so that might help. Pretty nice as a TV, too, although I doubt I'll ever replace my Panasonic plasma with an LED. Sound is excellent, important since I didn't want to fool with external speakers; this is actually what convinced me that the extra $100 was worth it for the 1080 over 720, 10x2 watts vs. 5x2.

Reviews.Title: Great TV awesome sound & picture
Reviews.Author: Dave Ojeda
Reviews.Content: Received the my TV yesterday, set-up was fast and easy. I read through all the reviews here and made some display settings they recommended, made a huge difference. Out of the box the picture was dark but after the setting changes the picture really popped!If this is your first HDTV and you are using cable or Dish, check your box settings, I have uVerse and my uVerse box was not set for HDTV output, changed one setting and it improved my TV viewing immediately.The exact model number I received was: UN32EH5000FXZAThe version# was TS01  (Samsung made panel)

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: L. J. Paleck Jr.
Reviews.Content: A Great TV at a very good price.  Fast delivery.Works fine, great picture and color and easy to setup and easy to connect.  All the Samsung products (2 PC monitors and 1 TV) have all been great.

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jason Calixte
Reviews.Content: i recommend this its the best replacement i ever bought only problem i have with it is that it doesn't have enough inputs but it works well.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Picky CO Mom
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for our bedroom. Something not too big but nice.  It fits in our room great and has a nice picture.  We did get the 1080 version so we can do high def over the air if we ever decide to get ride of satellite. I am very pleased with it.  It is the second Samsung TV that we own and I love them both.  Husband purchased another brand which died 3 times which is how I finally ended up with the one I wanted in the first place. :-)

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Superb picture quality in a very light weight thin television frame that has enhanced my viewing pleasure. I am very impressed with both the product and the price.

Reviews.Title: I'm brand loyal when it comes to my Samsung TV's
Reviews.Author: Vernie
Reviews.Content: I now have three Samsung Tv's ( one LCD and two LED ) because they have the best picture and best quality made.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: diehard
Reviews.Content: I love this Samsung TV . The usb port on the side is real handy to play music and movies The picture and sound is great. Very easy to set up.Would buy another.

Reviews.Title: Great TV. Exactly what I researched and ordered!
Reviews.Author: Tyler Jon Ainsworth
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Exactly what I researched and ordered! This TV was a steal. If you just want a good, quality LED HD TV like I did, without having to go for the tip top, then this is the one. This would be the bar set before you go and get a 80", or spend the $2000-$3500, or so, to get the absolute best in technology. The shipper shipped it properly, it arrived in great condition and it even arrived before it said it would be here by 4 days! I am extremely happy with this product. If what you need is a great 46" LED HD TV for movies, sports and video games, you wouldn't shoot yourself in the foot for this deal.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Television!
Reviews.Author: Natalie Reaves
Reviews.Content: Amazing price on Black Friday, great picture and perfect for my apartment room. The sound is standard for a stock but overall fairly nice. I hooked up my Xbox and stream through the TV. Best purchase this year!

Reviews.Title: HDTV
Reviews.Author: Dorie M
Reviews.Content: I've had the tv for a few weeks, and it has the most awesome picture.  HDTV with led.  I would recommend this Samsung to anyone who wants a tv for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: Ma
Reviews.Content: Picture is stunning!  Takes a little time to get use to the programming part, but is OK.  If ever need another TV, I'd buy one just like it!

Reviews.Title: Loved this tv!!!
Reviews.Author: Ricky Mathis
Reviews.Content: Got it today impressed by the picture and ease of setup absolutely no problems incurred with tv or setup!!! I recommend!!!!UPDATE THE SCREEN DEVELOPED A LINE RUNNING TOP TO BOTTOM A RESULT OF DEAD PIXELS. SO BEWARE THE SCREENS ON A MAJOR PATY OF THESE TV'S THAT ARR PRODYCED ARE >>>>>NOT<<<<< SAMSUNG!!!!!  DROP RATING TO ★ AT MOST!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good picture
Reviews.Author: S. Sanders
Reviews.Content: Using this to watch DVDs while working out. We don't have it hooked up to a big sound system or major entertainment system, but for our purpose the TV is just fine. Good picture and sound. Always had good results with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: gregory d anderson
Reviews.Content: I was shopping for a flat screen tv and did not know what kind, brand, model etc... I seen the reviews on this tv which was very good for those who bought it. I still wasn't sure so I waited a few days then decided to purchase this Samsung 32-inch. I am very pleased with this picture, sound and was very, very easy to set up. I would definetly get another one and so glad I bought this model. I don't play games on it, I only watch your normal viewer channels. If your looking for a flat screen 32-inch try this one!! :) :) Gregory. Albuquerque, NM

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jane L. Polcovar
Reviews.Content: I am not an electronics nerd, and to underscore that I will admit that I replaced a tube tv with this. That said, I did research LCD's, LED's and visited several stores to see my choices in real life. Samsung was highly rated, and this tv got excellent reviews overall.I don't watch sports, which I was told would make the HD more obvious. All I can say is the picture is clear, the color is fantastic, being able to easily make adjustments to my liking is wonderful, and I am very happy with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: KDog
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for our bedroom. True 1080p for less than $350!  Sound was much better than I anticipated. Was a little leary about ordering a TV on-line but the packaging and delivery was perfect!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, great sound
Reviews.Author: M. A. Rivera "Chelle"
Reviews.Content: This TV is beautiful. We had a 19" Samsung LED TV in the bedroom and decided to purchase this one for the living room. The picture is crisp and clear and the sound is great. On volume level 15 (about 1/5 up) I can hear the TV from my bedroom. The TV does not come with any cables of any kind (other than the power cord) so make sure you purchase an HDMI or the colored AV cables separately.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Quality
Reviews.Author: Skyliner
Reviews.Content: You pay more than some equivalent size sets, but to me its well worth the difference.  It has superior sound, picture and abilities to be useful.  I use it with my Apple TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Lack of Connections
Reviews.Author: william hankins
Reviews.Content: I had a Sanyo TV that lasted less than two years. It started to just shut down, so I called my cable company to come out to make sure it was the TV and not the cable box. It was the TV. I asked the cable man in his opinion what was the best TV since he is working with them all the time. He recommended Samsung or the high end Sharp. He has a Samsung and a Sony in his home. He also said that there were some TVs and Sanyo was one of them that they had trouble with when they were connected to the HDMI from the cable box. The solution was to use RCA connectors. Samsung and Sharp was not one of them. I ordered the 32" Samsung. I recieved it in two days although Amazon said it would take three. Even though it lacked connections I only had three items to hook up. I used the two HDMI connections for the cable box and my Roku. I used the RCA connection for my DVD recorder. This TV was so easy to setup that I had everything hooked up in 20 minutes from the time I unpacked it. The picture was very dark when I turned it on but when you went to Tools there were three settings to choose from. I chose Dynamic and the picture is excellent. I also like the sound. I was going to give it four stars because of lack of connections but it was so easy to setup and the picture so good I had to give it five stars. I learned my lesson from my Sanyo TV. Get the four year warranty.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture
Reviews.Author: Samer
Reviews.Content: I am a SAMSUNG customer since I started buying TVs. never disappointed by their quality and standards. lived in different places through the middle east and US and everywhere I go SAMSUNG proves to be the top TV maker (and other appliances as well). if you are planning to buy a new TV, buy samsung. if you have a non-samsung TV. compare it to SAMSUNG but promise you wont through your TV in the garbage (you can still donate it).

Reviews.Title: Great as a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Meng Qi
Reviews.Content: If you have shopped for monitors before, you probably know that IPS/VA monitors larger than 24 inches are very, very expensive.For example, a 23-inch Dell 2312HM costs slightly above $200 but its 27-inch brother (2712HM) costs about $700.This TV works as a perfect 32 inch monitor.  The contrast and color saturation is way above every TN monitor and most IPS monitors.Gaming and multimedia is incredible.  When playing Starcraft 2 you feel like a general sitting in a commanding room.  And, nowadays many games support the XBOX 360 controller on a PC.  Unless you want to play Xbox-exclusive games such as Halo, you can just get PC games and play them on your computer with an XBOX controller.But the quality of text is a bit less than ideal.  After a long time of viewing your eye might feel a little strained.If you connect the TV to your computer via a HDMI cable, or hook up the TV to your computer with a HDMI cable, you can get PC audio coming from the TV.  So you won't speakers anymore - saves you some more money.

Reviews.Title: Fine Picture
Reviews.Author: Movie maven "MM"
Reviews.Content: Got a good price on Amazon, and we're very satisfied with the picture.  Excellent clarity and easy to modify with the remote (movie, standard, enhanced settings).  Good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Isaacs-dad "MJM, MD"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these for a church;  I have always been pleased with Samsung products, and this one is of the same quality as I have come to expect.Only one thing-this TV does not have a VGA input, so it can not connect directly as a monitor to your computer.I had to get a usb-HDMI adapter to connect to the computer.

Reviews.Title: Good value ....
Reviews.Author: Harvey Schwartz
Reviews.Content: The picture quality on this unit is very good provided you "tweek" the custom picture options .....however, I found overscan on HDMI inputs which cuts off about 10% the sides, top and bottom of picture when on the standard 16:9 aspect ratio of high definition video is viewed ....trying to contact Samsung to see if there is a "work around" for this situation . Since the speakers are on the rear of the cabinet the sound quality is poor , this is especially apparent when the unit is placed in an entertainment center; I suggest a separate "sound bar" (like Zvox) be added to enhance the sound quality.

Reviews.Title: A good buy...
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for a family member who was still using the old tube type TV.  He loves it, the price was good and the picture is fine. He is not someone who needed to hook this up to any type of gaming device or wireless features so for viewing TV only or watching DVDs it's good. I wavered over the purchase because it is a 60hz v. 120hz, but I've read that it only makes a big difference if you are going for the screens that are larger than 32".I may purchase an additional one for my bedroom when my old tube TV dies as it is on the blink and likely has just a few months of life.*updated*  my old tube TV finally died.  I bought another one of these, for me, as a replacement bedroom TV. I did get it in a box store this time as they had it on sale and I could walk out with it in hand.  I have a 47" LG in my living room and have to say, I prefer this Samsung slightly over the LG.  If I have to buy another big screen in the future, it'll be Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Size
Reviews.Author: JDogg
Reviews.Content: Mounted this on my living room wall. Just the right size with a great picture. Resolution, color, and quality is right in line with the price. I wouldn't have chosen anything else. I use my Samsung to stream media off of a Roku and it does very well. The remote is still in good shape and haven't had any problems. The packaging it shipped with was sufficient and there was no damage to the unit.

Reviews.Title: Even for the electronically challenged
Reviews.Author: xkydivr
Reviews.Content: I am totally clueless when it comes to electronics so you will have to go to other reviews for the technical stuff. I got this TV for a bedroom. It was basically plug-n-play or I would still be pushing buttons.Easy to set up, great picture. I wanted to be able to use an older VCR/DVD (for some instructional VCR's) as well as a Blu-Ray player. Yes I know you can put the old tapes on DVD but I haven't figured out how to do that yet. I had to get a "component cable" for that and it works fine.  I thought the sound was a little "tinny" so I play it through  external speakers. It's possible I just don't know how to tweak it exactly right. The HD is as good as a larger  Samsung TV I have. Usual excellent Samsung quality.

Reviews.Title: HDTV Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Our old "big box" "LDTV" finally gave out after 25+ years, so we upgraded to the 32-inch Samsung HDTV since we were so delighted with our primary 46-inch Samsung purchased two years+ ago.  We're every bit as delighted with this set, and it fits our TV cabinet perfectly.  The non-swivel base is not an issue, as some reviews have suggested.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED TV
Reviews.Author: vanman "van"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Very easy to set up and absolutely no problems since. Great picture, too.Don't see how you can go wrong.

Reviews.Title: birthday present from amazon
Reviews.Author: AJH
Reviews.Content: I am not a technical person. I bought this TV for my husband's birthday.  It was easy to hook up and has a great picture.  Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: EBN
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a game room tv for my son so he can use it with his Xbox360 and watch movies.  He absolutely loves the TV!  The room is really bright, but this tv doesn't have a problem with that.  The picture looks great during the day or at night.  I also like the fact that is has a slick design and isn't an eyesore.  Another great thing is the sound.  I had a tight budget and didn't want to buy any additional speakers or sound system.  The sound is fantastic, clear and loud.  I couldn't have asked for more.Thinking about getting a 55" for the living room since I have been so impressed with this set...maybe in time for football season :)

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my bedroom
Reviews.Author: Dogwood
Reviews.Content: This TV is the perfect size and picture for my bedroom.  It's my first Samsung, and I couldn't be happier with the picture and overall quality of the set.  I really like that the brightness changes automatically depending on the light in the room.  I also wanted the 120Hz feature since I watch sports alot and a lot of my guy friends recommended that.Great styling and beautiful picture for the money, and it fits perfectly in the room.  At least 2 of my friends are now thinking of getting the same TV now that they've seen mine.

Reviews.Title: Samsung's great value and peformance!
Reviews.Author: Lucas K.
Reviews.Content: After reading some positive reviews on Amazon and looking at the great deal, I confidently decided on this model, and those reviews really did not lie.My first Samsung TV still resides in my living room and continues to please. This model was purchased for my bedroom and replaced my two year old bargain TV which broke down abruptly. My expectations of the Samsung brand was high and did not disappoint.I'm extremely pleased with the picture quality, sound quality, design and build quality. It suits my bedroom perfectly. While this model does not have internet connectivity or 3D capability, I was not seeking these features in a secondary bedroom TV.The UN46EH5000 is a solid performer without the extra "bells and whistles" that add cost and complicate operation.I highly recommend this TV to those seeking for value and well... a TV!

Reviews.Title: one of best interactions.
Reviews.Author: Deborah R. Griffith "9 lives to read"
Reviews.Content: This Tv has everything I could want. This Tv includes ports for additional equipment, such as blu-ray player,speakers etc. The picture quality is fantastic. The menu options exceeds itself for a greater picture view. To conclude I rate this tv a 5 star from all of the research that I did before I bought this tv.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Supertronic "Sotti"
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with this TV.  I did not feel we needed a smart TV or 3D or faster than 60Hz and so I don't feel like I paid a penny more than I needed to.  We now have a GREAT 50" Samsung screen hooked up where our old 40" Samsung screen was.  Amazon white glove delivery was awesome.  The standard 'energy saving' setting had a dim picture as it has the brightness turned way down, but changing it to dynamic or movie solved that right away.

Reviews.Title: It has to be a Samsung
Reviews.Author: R. Hunt
Reviews.Content: I've had a 42-inch LG for about 5 years, and last summer it just started dropping picture on half the screen, but would eventually work find after the wires warmed up. After lots of google searching, the best advice I could find was that the cost of fixing it would be close to the cost of replacing it, because the fault was in the wire leads coming from the LCD panel. So I ended up just leaving the TV turned on all day every day, so that when I wanted to watch it, it wouldn't mess up. Imagine leaving your tv on non-stop for six months. Eventually it's time to do something about it.I've always been a fan of LG, but when I read about how common my problem was, and how prohibitive a fix would be, I started to think that maybe I don't need to buy another tv from them.Meanwhile, I live in immediately downtown in a major city, and that means tv signals are bouncing around buildings and doing all sorts of strange things. In other words, tuning in a broadcast channel can at times be far more difficult than seems reasonable. The LG wasn't bad, but occasionally I would have to fuss with the antenna. Meanwhile, my roommate's little Samsung always got a great picture and the antenna never needed to be adjusted. So I decided to try Samsung for my replacement.You wouldn't think the TV itself would have anything to do with the signal, but it does. Samsung TVs have superior tuners. My channels are more clear, and I never have to mess with the antenna any more. I'm sure the other manufacturers are cheaping out on the assumption that everyone has cable or satellite or whatever, but if you're going to make a television, it should be good at being a television, and I sure am glad that Samsung puts that quality tuner in their TVs.There are now three Samsung televisions in my apartment, and I just bought one for my dad. They've won a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: A great TV at a Great Oruve,
Reviews.Author: Gym Cop
Reviews.Content: a great tv.  It repaced the 720o in my game room and results are amazing, the pixelation is smooth and the the tv is photo sensative, it adjusts to varying lighting conditions.  A totally great tv, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Beware of the Samsun Panel Lottery.
Reviews.Author: Nabeel
Reviews.Content: Before I review, refer to the top review for this item, what that user states is 100 percent correct. I received a A panel and it looks no where near as good as the Samsung panel. It still looks good after a good setup I found online, but it looks really washed out on default. Be aware that when you buy this tv, you are playing a gamble.

Reviews.Title: It works fantastic as a computer monitor. Great buy for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Mr. & Mrs. Kramer
Reviews.Content: This review is about how this tv works as a computer monitor. If your not going to use it as a computer monitor, then this review will not be relevant to you. This review is about what the other reviews don't tell you as far as a monitor goes. So I will not repeat what the other reviews do say. The other reviews do tell you the part I'm not going to tell you. So to learn more about this tv, be sure to read the other reviews also.I wanted a new super large computer monitor and since tv's were now up to 1920x1080, I thought a good one might work ok as a large monitor. So I researched long and hard and settled on this one because of its high resolution and reputation for great clarity and fantastic picture quality.I went ahead and bought this tv for use as a computer monitor nearly exclusively. It works fantastic. Its much much better than my two Dell monitors that came with my computers. Be sure you understand what HDMI is and that your computer can output to HDMI. This tv does NOT have the old standard VGA or SVGA. So I had to buy a adapter Plugable UGA-165 USB 2.0 to VGA/DVI/HDMI Adapter for Windows, Multiple Monitors up to 1920x1080 / 1600x1200 Each (DisplayLink DL-165 Chipset). It worked very well for me.The tv does NOT come set up to work as a monitor right out of the box. But it is so adjustable it can be tweaked to work perfectly as a monitor. It took me a hour of non stop fiddling and adjusting to find the sweet spot that worked oh so well for me. But once you finally find the sweet spot, it works fantastic. Until you find the sweet spot, you wont be impressed but nor disappointed.I use it sometimes up to 12 hours a day as a monitor and it does not tire out my eyes or bother me. Its actually better than the real computer monitors. Well, at least compared to my Dells. Its much brighter if you want it to be, or as dim as you want to set it at. The colors are more vivid and realistic. The lines and text are crystal clear if you sit more than 30" from it. If your closer than 24" the text has a very minor blur that can be noticed but does not annoy you too much.For the best picture be sure to set your computer at 1920x1080 and nothing lower. Everything else you adjust from the tv side with the remote control.The two biggest improvements this tv has over a normal monitor (not counting the huge size at a bargain price) is black and white. I dont mean looking at things in black and white, I mean the specific colors of being white and the color of black.What was black on my old dell monitor, now sometimes shows up as very dark grays with tons more detail visible. If it was super dark gray, my old monitor just showed it as black as it smudged out the real available detail. Now I can see what I used to miss.And white. What I used to call white on my old monitor, was a yellow type of white. Not true white. This tv shows true white if you turn its brightness up high enough. I actually cant use all the brightness this tv has available. For two reasons. 100% bright makes the fine delicate lines and text begin to fade away until they are hard to see or nearly invisible if they are real fine. And the biggest reason. When I look at this tv in the dark with no other lights on, the tv is just too bright at 100% and bothers my eyes and blinds me. Its like looking into a flashlight.  So for me 85% brightness gives me true white without blinding me nor making the fine delicate lines begin to fade.On all of my previous computer monitors I always had the brightness turned all the way up and it still was not enough. Its so good that this tv actually has brightness left over that I don't need. That is really saying something.Once you buy this tv, your likely to still own your original computer monitor. Now you can use two monitors at the same time on your computer since you will now have two. One VGA and one HDMI.I was so surprised to see them both perform side by side simultaneously. OMG, I had no idea how lacking my old monitor was until it was compared with this tv. This tv is so superior as a monitor that I feel samsung is missing their branding call. They should be selling and advertising this thing as a computer monitor. There is so much market they are missing.1 not only is the size fantastic and incredible for the price when compared to real monitor prices,but 2, its performance surpasses normal monitors and maybe the best super high dollar monitors can equal it that cost over a grand, but its just so much value as a monitor for such a bargain price.But its not a monitor out of the box. Its only a fantastic monitor when you tweak it to perform just so and find the sweet spot, which fortunately is available to be found if you look, search, fiddle and experiment enough. Sissy's wont find it because they quit too easily. Maybe thats why samsung doesn't advertise this as a monitor because lots of idiots wont figure out how to tweak it to perfection. That I do believe.Here is why I wont tell you what numbers and settings to tweak it to. Because I tweaked it to perfection with my 1st computer. Later I bought a newer computer and then the monitor sucked. I had to re-tweak it to perfection again with the different computer. And again I found the perfection or sweet spot. So now I have NO reason to believe what settings are perfect for one computer, are even good for another computer.On my 1st computer I had to have the sharpness setting turned way down. But on my next computer I had to turn my sharpness up to 65. That surprised me much. And other settings where quite similar in their dissimilarity between the two computers. That is one thing samsung did fantastically on this tv, they made it so broadly adjustable in every area.I dont use this as a tv at all. However I do watch tons of video from my computer. I discovered I had to discover the sweet spot of compromise. I can tweak this to perfection for watching computer video, but then using it as a desktop or browser suffers much. I can tweak this to perfection as a desktop or browser, but then it suffers much in the video category.So I discovered I have to tweak it to 85% of perfection in the video category so my desktop and browser can be 90% up to their best. I had to find that little spot of compromise so they both look fantastically good, but neither one is at its best. And then they both work fantastically for me and I'm delighted with my level of minor compromise as neither end is suffering much. The compromise is actually very very little. But without it one end or the other suffers quite much while the other end is just a little bit better than if there was no compromise.So be very ready to play with it tons as you learn how to tweak it and then discover the other variables. If your not a quick learner then maybe this tv is not going to work fantastically as a monitor for you.Whereas I didn't tell you what numbers to set to, I believe I have steered you in the right direction so you now know what to go looking for and pay attention to. When I pulled mine out of the box and plugged it in, for an hour I was scared I just threw away a bunch of money as its performance was sub par. But desperation drove me to continue searching for the right settings to rescue me and I found them with perseverance and due diligence.There are a lot of tv's nowadays that have 1920x1080. HOWEVER nearly none of them except this samsung have the adjustably to tweak it to perfection as a monitor. If you buy anything cheaper than this one for monitor use, be ready to be disappointed as you cant adjust it to your liking. BEWARE, I WARNED YOU.This tv is everything I wished and hoped for in a computer monitor. But it wasn't the lowest priced tv out there. HOWEVER I believe it works better as a monitor than any other tv out there.If you have questions post a comment and I will get back to you shortly.Good luck and let me know if this review helped you. I want to know how many other people are considering this tv for mainly monitor purposes so let me know.Chris

Reviews.Title: Great for HD and Blu-ray!
Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 40" LED to replace a 6-year-old 26" Sony LCD as my living room TV. Newer Sonys are pricey so I did a little research and opted for this Samsung. Unfortunately, many local stations claiming to broadcast in HD don't seem to be "true" high def... however, Blu-ray and animated movies look spectacular. I've read mostly positive reviews on here - not sure what the deal is with the whole "panel lottery" topic... doesn't seem to apply to the TV I bought, and if it does there's nothing wrong with the panel from what I can tell. Flawless picture when watching true high definition programming. I'm satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the savings
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because of the name on the front and the great price but was very disappointed in the quality. Motion blur was horribly noticable on non HD channels and only slightly better on HD programming. HD movies looked great but I was expecting much more overall quality from Samsung. This 60is hz bumped to 120 by cleara motion is blur horrible. Thank you Amazon for the easy return.Do not buy this tv

Reviews.Title: awesome so far but a couple questions...update
Reviews.Author: R. Hood
Reviews.Content: got this recently for my bedroom .... first off the picture quality when playing xbox is incredible...and i stuck in The Dark Knight blu ray and its the best ive ever seen it look....better than our 40 inch toshiba......blu rays and xbox look great on it.....wish the hdmi ports werent on the side...looks annoying staring at wires on the side but oh well......now i have a question if anyone can help me out please comment....when i watch a REGULAR dvd the quality doesnt seem to be very good at all.....my girlfriend has a 32 inch Dynex 720p with a built in dvd player...when we watch dvds on it the picture looks incredible..almost blu ray quality even.....but on this tv a regular dvd looks almost like VHS tape quality.......the blu ray player i am using is an older model Panasonic BD35 bought in 2008 perhaps that has something to do with it? im not sure...but its kind of a letdown in terms of picture quality when viewing a regular dvd...again this could be my blu ray player and maybe its time to buy a newer model..any comments on that would be appreciatedUPDATE 9/6/12tinkered with the settings and now my regular dvds dont look so bad....the one gripe i have now is some slight motion blur problems...most noticeable when playing sport games on my xbox and on some dvds...but turning off digital noise reduction seemed to have lessened the blur some...oh well.....i hate Samsung has resorted to coming up with this 120 CMR marketing gimmick....this "motion plus" option does nothing but darken the picture.....anyways if u dont mind a little blur here and there its a good tv.........ive thought about returning it but i like the size for my room and its hard to find a 32 inch 120hz tv so im probably going to stick with it....its easy to navigate through and change settings and the sound is quite impressive

Reviews.Title: Pretty impressive
Reviews.Author: Roger Maxwell
Reviews.Content: What surprised me:- The blackness of the blacks. As good or better than my Sony KDL55HX750!- The sound quality. It was better than I expected given the price, size, and purpose of this TV.- The number of audio/video adjustments available in the menu for such a basic unit.What I don't like:- The HDMI connectors are on the side.- It's a bit "chunky" in terms of thickness for a modern LCD. Thinness was obviously not a primary design goal.I started out with the UN32EH4000 because I didn't need 1080p. Unfortunately, the 4000 doesn't have a light sensor to automatically adjust the backlight to ambient light levels. It was inconvenient to have to adjust the backlight twice each day, so I upgraded to the 5000 and solved that problem. (Samsung calls it an "Eco Sensor".)

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Annette
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this television. I am a big believer in Samsung products. The picture is amazing! I would highly recommend this product. It fit all my needs.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: R. Apte
Reviews.Content: You may need to fiddle with the picture controls a bit to get things right, but the picture from this moderately priced 46" display is great.  I have it connected to a PC with tuner/DVD/BR inputs through a yamaha receiver. The only problem I had was that EDID reported 300dpi, so the computer fonts were huge. Once I set the dpi correctly, everything was fine. Highly recommended. I bought this to replace my last Samsung (died after ~4 years, which is not good)--Samsung makes very nice looking displays.

Reviews.Title: Forced to wide screen
Reviews.Author: MoparNut "moparnut"
Reviews.Content: I had no problems setting up the new style TV.  Although I don't like to review a product based on its performance over such a short time frame, at this point I would say it is everything I expected.  The picture is sharp and sound great.  Time will tell if it has the life span I expect.

Reviews.Title: Great TV don't believe the negative hype!
Reviews.Author: Leonidas "Flyfisher"
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic for the price, we picked picked it up for $399.  The colors are really eye popping and the blacks are inky black with  really nice contrast.  My daughter was watching Once Upon a Time in Wonderland tonight and the show looked really amazing.  The sound is very good as well;  we don't have this hooked up to speakers or a sound system.We were not looking for a 3D set or a smart TV. We already have devices to take care of the smart TV side of things,  and the 3D just isn't important to me at this point.  We have this set in our family room which is quite small so this 40 inch panel is more than enough.I am really amazed by all of the experts on here and the whole Samsung panel lottery hoopla hysteria.  Show me some proof (Hopefully Thoughtful) that anyone has substantive proof that they absolutely know where any of these panels come from. In Hopefully's case people were still quoting him/her  a year later like he was the frigging authority on Samsung panels. I am sitting here laughing as I write this!  He/she never even came back on Amazon to write his/her promised follow up (updated) review.  What a bunch of junk!  I wonder if Hopefully Thoughtful works for one of Samsung's competitors(just kidding).I have no idea where my panel comes from,  but I do know this TV is really nice(especially at 399)!Peace...

Reviews.Title: Can't recommend this TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I Bought this model TV (brand new in original box - not refurbished) less than 8 months ago, and already I'm in the process of scheduling a warranty repair. The picture suddenly became too dark on all settings. Samsung phone support determined that it needs to be repaired... completely unacceptable.My last TV, a Sony 42" Plasma, lasted for 8 YEARS before it died.This is probably the LAST Samsung product I'll ever buy. They always develop problems within the first year of use. Every Samsung item I've ever bought has failed in one way or another - this TV and at least 3 different smartphones. I chose this over a comparable Panasonic model, and now I regret it.Don't risk buying a Samsung TV - at least not this particular model. Panasonic, Sony and Sharp are the proven quality brands, based on my experience.-------UPDATE (March, 2014): After 2 warranty repairs, this TV has been working great for the past 6 months. But the fact that it needed to be serviced TWICE to replace faulty parts within the first year, is still plenty of reason that this will be my last Samsung TV purchase.

Reviews.Title: Did i really need this high end of a tv for a second TV
Reviews.Author: Pudge
Reviews.Content: Quality over quantity.....or bells and whistlesSeems like every device i have or would have , dvd, B-dvd players, Xbox, playstation, any media servers roku, WD live, boxee - they all have pretty much have offerins for the services provided by smart tv's.I wanted picture quality and got it - the picture is crisp and amazing - and yes you have to tweak it out of the box but that should be a "known" givin.It was a bit expensive compared to other offerings but I wanted the best quality and this was it. Costco had the 5050 for about $50 cheaper with specs that really shouldnt make that much of a difference as a second tv and looking back i could have settled for a toshiba or vizio for about half the price of both of those.Its a second tv and my only second guessing is just that, did i really need to spend that much on a second tv for a bedroom. But i couldnt be happier with the quality. I started with a WD Live and it worked so well I ended up connecting a spare PC with a good Vid card and it looks awesome and i can watch or do anything with it.The only reason i can think of for not giving it a 5th star would be the price against how stripped down it is.Plan well as it only has 2 HDMI ports.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF GLOSSY SCREEN AND REFLECTIONS/GLARE
Reviews.Author: I. Wells
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung UN40EH5000 40-Inch TV. I have a different model, purchased four years ago, in my bedroom which I am quite pleased with. I wanted to get a Samsung for my living room and this model had many good reviews and during Black Friday the price dropped $50 and it became even more appealing. I received it last week. My friend set it up, that was easy. We both looked at the picture and it was exceptional. I was very happy. I left the room and came back later and sat to admire my lovely Samsung. It was then I noticed something very disturbing. In addition to the picture I could view a reflection of the room, windows, mirror, lights etc. It was disturbing and completely distracting. I have never experienced this with my other Samsung or other TVs. I am not sure if this relates to the review someone posted, Many don't have Samsung panels a huge quality difference. In any event there was no way I could enjoy what would have been a great picture when I had to view every other detail in my room at the same time. I cannot imagine who would not find that a complete distraction. I immediately decided it had to go back. I called Amazon and as always, pleased to help, they arranged to have the TV picked up and returned at no cost.I still wanted a Samsung and also wanted to know why the screen was  "glossy" a description they used when I finally managed to talk to someone. I was amazed it existed. That was followed by more calls to them. I was trying to find a model without a glossy screen, no reflection or glare. They were not helpful but I finally managed to speak to someone who was not sure but thought model LN40E550F7FXZA, might be glare free. It was the same size and approximate cost of the one I returned. After endless other phone calls, trying to confirm this with no success I finally found Best Buy had the TV. They have a Geek squad and I spoke to someone there. He clearly was informed and said the screen was glare free. I asked him how could anyone enjoy the picture if the room was reflected. He said there were many complaints about this but Samsung was selling the glossy screen and the model I called about appeared to be the only one without that horrible feature, at least in a 40" screen. I rushed to the store to see it. There was no glare and the picture was quite good, I purchased it. I noticed all of the other Samsung TV's on display had horrible glossy screens and for that matter, so did other brands.I am perplexed having not seen another review like this. Had I, I would never have bought that model. I can only assume the distraction did not bother other people. Nevertheless I had to write this review to warn anyone who may find this feature disturbing as I did. I am very pleased with model LN40E550F7FXZA. I hope this review helps someone. One of the great things about Amazon is the reviews from people without a vested interest in a given product.

Reviews.Title: Samsung makes great TV's that are best in their class
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: Samsung makes great TV's that surpass every other manufacturer in their class. I have this TV as well as another Samsung in my house and I can tell you the image is beautiful. The only drawback with this TV its not a smart TV and you would need to use a WiFi router like Google TV or a Roku to get it to connect to the internet. This is why I gave this TV 4 stars instead of 5. But if this is not an issue then this TV is great.One thing that I have found with TV's that its very important to actually look at the TV in person. Now when you look at the TV's, go to a place like Walmart to see them, because many times specialty stores like Best Buy play with the lighting controls on the TV and in the store to skew the image to there advantage. Once you look at the TV simply look and decide which one looks better to you.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: Can hook up a WD USB hard drive to this TV
Reviews.Author: DmK
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as a present to replace an old CRT. The quality of the picture is quite good.The TV has a USB input, to play movies/display pictures from a USB flash drive. I found that I can hook up Western Digital Passport 1TB USB hard drive to it and use TV's built-in media player to play AVI/MKV/MP4 files. Very cool and space per megabyte is x10 cheaper than the flash drive. Unfortunately, VOB files are not supported (unless they are converted to AVI/MKV/MP4). There some other formats this TV can play, the manual (available on Samsung site) details them.There are also 2 HDMI, component, AV (RCA), and antenna inputs.

Reviews.Title: Sansung HDTV from Amazon
Reviews.Author: W. Ashby
Reviews.Content: The picture is beautiful, just what I expected. I had an Avion HDTV 32 that was almost the same size, it had speakers attached on either end and was LCD. The LCD light went out after 7 years so, time to replace it. The Samsung 40 fits in the same space, and is perfect for my application. The LED's should last longer than the LCD.

Reviews.Title: great price for a bigger TV (i use for sports, movies, gaming).
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: Its a great TV for the price.  Simple to set up and good to go.  I bought this TV because i wanted a slightly bigger one than my previous 24" samsung without having to spend around a thousand dollars.  The settings are off when you initially begin to watch, but i found the optimal settings for my dim-lit apartment room.  I mostly use the TV to watch sports and movies and found these settings to be the best for me and i hope it helps some of you out:mode - dynamicbacklight-17brightness-40contrast-85color-77sharpness-70G50/R50warm-1 color toneenjoy!

Reviews.Title: Big, but not necessarily better
Reviews.Author: Rosa Maria Eubanks
Reviews.Content: You have to be right in front to be able to benefit from the picture.  Sides are not that great.  Sound leaves much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: The Best inexpensive HDTV!
Reviews.Author: Ivan Marquez "Ivan NY"
Reviews.Content: As with all Samsung products so far, this HDTV is the best inexpensive television ever!The 60Hz conversion rate is more than plenty to make this HDTV's amazingly low price a terrific find!

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: Michael Battaglia
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality but definitely follow other people's reviews on how to adjust the picture settings. The sound is great; I've done away with the speakers I used to use in favor of less clutter and just use the built in TV audio now.

Reviews.Title: So glad I went for it!
Reviews.Author: Erin Dabrowski
Reviews.Content: I bought this after careful consideration and research of reviews.  The picture is great (I went online and found different settings to try).  The sound is decent (I didn't go with the ultra-slim because I didn't want to worry about getting a soundbar).  40'' is definitely big enough for my apartment.  I almost went to the 46'', but in the end, saving $100 was totally worth it for the smaller one.  I've got Google Chrome as well.  They work great together.

Reviews.Title: 2 small quibbles. Mainly just works out of the box. UN40EH5000
Reviews.Author: Benjamin D Bullock
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a "dumb" TV to use with a gifted Chromecast I received a few months back. This combination works great. I've hooked up a Mohu Leaf (to pull in the local HD channels in Chicago), and use Netflix to fill in our other needs.The picture is quite good on antenna and HDMI. Several picture presets to choose from (which can be adjusted to suite your needs). Movie mode was the closest to my needs, then I adjusted for a couple days to dial it in for my tastes and environment.The speakers are quite good as well. I had anticipated needing a sound  bar for any LCD TV I bought, but the built-in speakers have a pretty good range (lows to highs) and the volume can get pretty loud without any distortion. Again, several presets to choose from or you can custom EQ it with the offered basic settings. Suffice to say, a sound bar purchase has been put on the back burner.2 quibbles: I had tried some of the offered picture settings featured in the top reviews. For whatever reason, they don't produce good pictures on the current editions of this model. I keep the sharpness as low as possible (sitting at 15-20), otherwise I get a ghosting effect on a white background.The other quibble is related to a white background as well (and is an often remarked criticism of LCD technology), and that is shaded corners. If my TV were worse, I'd probably send it back, but as it is (on bright white backgrounds) it only appears as a super soft vignette. It is not noticeable 95% of the time I'm watching TV and I probably would have never noticed if I wasn't looking for it.All-in-all, this TV offers really good picture quality and sound for the money.

Reviews.Title: Would recommend!
Reviews.Author: J. Jobes
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that this TV is great.  It has great quality and is nice and big! Really, that is all I expected of this TV, as I didn't need it to be Smart as I have other components to get my Netflix, Hulu, etc.  The TV speakers are pretty decent as well, but are a little weird as my ears can pick up that the sound is coming out of the back of the TV and is almost reflecting off the wall to get to the audience(does any one else notice this?).However, the only bummer about this TV (and the only reason why I gave it 4 stars) is that lack of input options available.  There are only 2 HDMI ports and 1 Component/AV hookup on the TV.  Granted, there is a usb port, which is nice for putting movies on a USB stick and plugging it in (which works great), but the combined Component/AV hookup is slightly annoying.  I have to admit that I have quite a few devices that I wanted to hook up to my TV, and was planning on buying a surround sound system with a receiver that could handle all the necessary hookups.In the end, if you just want a high quality non-smart TV that you want to plug your cable/dish box into and then maybe a video game system - you should be set, but beware if you have a lot of devices that your options are going to be limited.  Otherwise, great product!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Money!
Reviews.Author: Jeff "Sailbum"
Reviews.Content: The TV has a very good picture.  The matte finish screen eliminates glare without detracting from the sharpness of the picture.  The sound quality is not bad for in TV speakers and is fine for anyone other than an audiophile.  The set up was quick and easy.  The only adjustment I needed to make was to the color settings - the green was over saturated which resulted in a cartoonish look, particularly with things like grass watching football games.  This was easily corrected to get a very good color balance.  I have not noticed any halo effect or color bleeding at all.  This set has very good picture quality for the price and I would definitely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Samsung, great product
Reviews.Author: Curtis Yoak
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, it was easy to install and hook up, I was watching it 15 minutes after I opened the box. The picture and sound quality are amazing. I have had this TV for a few weeks now and I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Mostly positive reviews not for no reason.
Reviews.Author: sasquatch
Reviews.Content: Excellent for my purposes. Undemanding, but not insensible, viewer of Verizon FIOS and DVDs. I can tell it's a better picture than I've had before. The device was a snap to set up and the HDMI connection worked first time.
