Reviews.Author: Brit Lit/Brit Flick Fan
Reviews.Content: My Sony Bravia died after 3 years of light to moderate use. This was easier to set up and the picture and sound is great.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG HDTV
Reviews.Author: CJ Howard Jr
Reviews.Content: A great purchase made better by the temporary use of a PRIME Account!  It was the lowest, albeit NOT significantly lower, price than anyone...and FREE shipping!  The picture was fabulous, although I did NOT like the location of the HDMI connections!  In all, a GREAT buy...!

Reviews.Title: Great Value !
Reviews.Author: SJB321 "Very Good Cook"
Reviews.Content: This set has a terrific HD picture and is very reasonably priced considering the features it has.  Some of the directions were confusing and I needed to call the company, but most people would probably not find any problem with understanding how to hook it up.  I am no technically inclined and had trouble with the picture size, but once I realized that I didn't have an HDMI cable, all was resolved satisfactorily.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Julia Jackson
Reviews.Content: TV has a very clear picture and good sound.  It's small compared to what's available but is perfect for our bedroom.  We are very happy with it.  We plan to mount it on the wall soon, which will make it even easier to see.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get Samsung to answer me by phone or chat
Reviews.Author: sally d cunningham
Reviews.Content: Once I read other reviews and finally got the TV programmed for best picture, with Comcast, I'm well pleased.  Still think my Vizio  had a better picture and the service center was prompt and very helpful.  Info for you out there, like myself, know little about TVs.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: jordan ebbers
Reviews.Content: I spent alot of time researching and looking at other TV's as well. I'm a gamer, and i bought the MediaBridge HDMI cable along with it, connecting to my computer, the picture, is clear, it's big, beautiful, i promise you will enjoy every bit of it, comes with a simple, but nice remote and some batteries for it, the TV Speakers are powerful for onboard speakers, it's just absolutely amazing!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good tv
Reviews.Author: Frank Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Real clear picture. Not to dark or to light(if your settings are correct) I may have to change my other tvs to Samsung.

Reviews.Title: OK for a PC monitor but too few settings
Reviews.Author: math-tutorchicago-org
Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung TV to use it as a PC monitor. You have to name the HDMI input to "PC" and the picture coming from your PC will look much better. The sound of this TV has a weird hollow bass so I tend to keep the bass to minimum. This is true for most TV's out there.The problem when using the TV as a PC monitor is that once you name the input to PC, many of the HDMI settings become unavailable and you are not able to tweak the picture. For example, there is no setting controlling the color saturation, unless you change each color yourself (good luck with that). I liked that the TV has a matte screen but often the picture looked either too washed out (without color) or with too few levels of dark (the dark levels merged into one black). Yes, my TV had a screen manufactured by Samsung not a third party.The crispiness of the text as a PC monitor was OK but it was always a tradeoff with the quality of picture when watching movies: when you improve one of those with the settings, the other deteriorates. Also, I noticed white tones in Windows got weird hues when changing only Contrast. A good TV is not supposed to do that. I don't know if that was typical for this model TV or the one I got was mildly defective - it was "used as new".In the end I bought LG 32LN5300 which is much more pleasing to the eyes as a PC monitor and has settings you can tweak in that mode. Don't buy a used LG from Amazon sellers, it may be defective and shut down by itself. I returned one of those and bought one from a local seller that works without problem.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture very light body.
Reviews.Author: Adrian Mann
Reviews.Content: This is an EH series Samsung TV. The EHs are cheaper TVs as far as the body is concern. It's light to the point of being flimsy but the electronics and the LCD panel is first quality. The picture is magnificent even from extrem angles.It's an LED panel very bright and clorfull which requires a little more work to adjust properly.If you want a less expensive light TV from Samsung with first class screen and LED light at a great price you can't find any better then this.

Reviews.Title: It's O.K.
Reviews.Author: jerri
Reviews.Content: I like the physical presentation when the TV is off.  When it is on, there are series of small red pixels in the center of the screen which are visible when the neutral/black screen is on......not really noticeable when viewing TV programs.  So, I judged it was not worth the effort to ship it back.  However, the price led me to believe that I would get a perfect TV!  The sound is adequate; if you wish enhanced, you might want to get the sound bar/base speaker enhancement........I didn't bother as I do not care about sound that much.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Deirdre
Reviews.Content: This tv is perfect. You can put it together (stand) with ease and it is very easy to understand the set up instructions. It took about ten minutes to watch it from the time we opened the box. It's a perfect size with a crystal clear picture and the sound is great! Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: A 32" Samsung 1080p HDTV that lives up to it's promise
Reviews.Author: Keith H. Colton "Online Shopper"
Reviews.Content: It was only after watching my Samsung 32" HDTV (since 2008), and only after watching HDTV's here, there,and everywhere, that I learned that your TV must display a resolution of 1080i or 1080p in order to geta true HD experience. For me, going from analog to HD was like when TV went from Black and White to Colors.I'm a serious TV watcher, a lover of game shows, as well comedy and drama.  My old Samsung was OK, but witha 720p resolution I didn't cry when I couldn't turn it on anymore. That's right, I pushed the on button onthe set and the one on the remote, but it wouldn't turn on. I expected repair would be expensive, so decided toshop for a new one on Amazon.com and found just what I was looking for, a high tech 32" 1080p LED HDTV at a decentprice. What was so special was the financing. I have 6 months to pay for it with no interest unless I default. (Nomissed or late payments). Sweet. I also got next day shipping and 30 day free tech support from Amazon. Everythingwent swell , and I got what I wanted. True HDTV in Color. Need I say more? I love that picture. Now don't botherme, I'm watching Southland.

Reviews.Title: Sweet TV!
Reviews.Author: Ellie S.
Reviews.Content: In general this TV has a nice crisp screen. I did alot of research on TVs this size and settled on this one so I could set it on my desk to use as both a TV and a monitor with 1080p. I didn't want the Smart TV bells & whistles either. I have found it a bit too large to use as a monitor, and the text isn't quite as sharp as a monitor, but I'm used to all that now. Where it shines is with streaming Netflix, DVD movies, TV shows, etc. which look all superb.

Reviews.Title: Had to replace my Panasonic TV
Reviews.Author: pat
Reviews.Content: My Panasonic TV just stopped working and the repair would cost more than a new set!!! I went to my trusted Consumer Reports and the Samsung was one of the the top rated TVs.  I ordered through Amazon and had it by the next evening.. I love the quality of the picture, the sound and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Mr. Honest
Reviews.Content: I received it promptly and in good condition.It took a lot of tweekingbut it was my first LED TV. but I am well satisfied with the pictureand the audio was better than expected.The remote is dinky though.I am well satisfied at this point,good TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Bedroom Flat Screen TV
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: We wanted something around this size for our bedroom and didn't need all the "Smart TV" features that seem to come standard on TVs of this size and up.  So, this Samsung fit the bill perfectly.  I would recommend this model to anyone with a similar need.  Great choice.

Reviews.Title: Meat & Potato's Performance
Reviews.Author: Ivan Pozo Illas "Ivan Pozo-Illas"
Reviews.Content: Hi There,This Samsung LED TV is easy to set up in a matter of a few minutes. With just a screw driver to fasten the bottom TV stand screws. The color brightness settings took multiple viewings on my part to nail down. Since my TV sits close to the outside glare of a window. At night the colors are still darker, but consider it a work in progress on my end.My only complaint is in raising and lowering the volume. Where a left vertical menu appears where I need to press my cable Tv (Comcast) synced remote. Needing to press multiple times just to lower or raise the volume. Unlike other TV remotes where you just hold down or press up and the volume goes accordingly.Other than that this television is providing an adequate experience.

Reviews.Title: Great display, sound performance sub-par.
Reviews.Author: REB "Rich"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to install on a covered patio.  Picture is great, now I have recalibrated it.  My only disapointment is the quality of the sound.  It has enough audio power, that's not the issue, but the obvioulsy small speakers seem to be incapable of handling low frequencies without distorting.  I have adjusted the built in graphic equalizer to turn down the 100Hz range significantly, and this has helped, but now need to supplement the audio with additional external speakers to fill in the missing low end frequencies.

Reviews.Title: 32" Samsung LED TV is nice, but not great
Reviews.Author: Russ A Carpenter
Reviews.Content: Overall a good TV for the money (I'm using this one in the bedroom), but if you aren't looking at it directly, the blacks fade, and the sound is not as good as the old Panasonic LCD TV this one is replacing.  If you connect a nice set of computer speakers/woofer to the line out, the sound is significantly better that way.  My 46" sansumg LED we use in our livingroom seems to have a much better picture than this 32" model, so that is mainly why I'm knocking it down to 3 stars (and the sound being sub-par too).

Reviews.Title: Would Be Great if 480-1080 upscaling was not so blury
Reviews.Author: TimInRochester
Reviews.Content: I know many people have claimed to have to fuss with the picture settings to be happy, but for me no settings were good enough for broadcasts in 480.  The TV upscales to 1080 and the TV I ordered Samsung UN32EH5000 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black) was giving me headaches from eyestrain because the inability to focus. This was most appearent on Newscasts or Panel discussions.  Contacted Samsung and they thought something was wrong with the set.I liked the built in wifi ,the TV had very good sound from the stock speakers and the USB media player, it like having a 32"digital photo frame. 720 and 1080 broadasts were much better than 480, less upscaling. I had to return it as 480 broadcasts were untolerable, going to buy another brand, since I did not want to deal with and excanged unit doing the same thing.

Reviews.Title: Very nice with one minor negative
Reviews.Author: Kceld
Reviews.Content: This is overall a very nice TV. Beautiful picture - color, brightness, contrast range. The TV is stylish and lightweight. The sound is good too. My one minor negative of this TV is that the image brightness fades a bit into the far corners. For a full array LED backlit TV it should have better even illumination overall, and I have seen better even illumination into the corners (on more expensive TVs, of course). Most of the time this is not noticeable and of minor concern. Other than this I am very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this TV for Netflix as the current 2/16 Firmware issue is not covered under warranty
Reviews.Author: Nancy Hines
Reviews.Content: I loved the TV for 9 months and enjoyed my Netflix account until one day Netflix quit working. It was unable to play any titles and said to try again later. I went through a month of calls to Samsung, called Netflix, called my ISP. I have chatted with support and done everything they said to try. Nothing worked to fix Netflix, it kept saying it was unable to play any titles right now, to try again later. Netflix support had me Deactivate and reactivate it and still no joy. Finally, Samsung sent a tech out and he had Support connect remotely and they determined my network was too slow. Which I knew was incorrect as nothing had changed with it and it worked fine for 9 months. My ISP was barely providing 3 Mbps download so I changed ISP and now get 30 Mbps download. I called Samsung back and tried to get a tech to come back out as I am convinced the Motherboard has failed after finding a Samsung forum where a Samsung tech stated he replaced the motherboard and it fixed this problem. I called Samsung numerous times and they argued and argued. I have a computer hardware background as well as Cisco certification CCNA. I know about hardware and this could be fixed in warranty but Samsung refuses to own up and perform the repair. So I advised -DO NOT BUY THIS TV FOR NETFLIX.  After 6 weeks of chats, calls, the executive team saying the TV is fine I went and bought a second one, same model. It plays Netflix FINE, as it has updated chips on its motherboard and it has an updated Firmware version that is not available to the public at this time. I had to argue and insist they repair the TV so they finally sent out a USB device that was to have the 1039 version of the firmware - it didn't. After waiting two weeks for a USB drive (ever heard of FTP Samsung?) the USB had the same version of firmware that doesn't work - 1037. So I call and argue some more and get placed on hold, disconnected twice and now they say I get to wait two more weeks for another USB drive with the right Firmware version.I specifically requested a tech come out since the network speed was drastically improved and they refused stating the TV is not broken. Last night 2/26 the tech FINALLY admitted after 20 calls, chats and a home visit where they ALL DENIED an issue existed - FINALLY I am told - YES right now there is a Firmware issue with Netflix and Samsung WILL NOT REPAIR the TV as they say it is not broken. Additionally, they are meeting with Netflix daily to resolve the Firmware issue and gave me an ETA of two weeks for the 'Fixed' firmware to be available to the public. It worked fine for 9 months and then failed to function properly and its not the TV that's broken? I know for a fact that replacing the motherboard would fix my faulty TV but Samsung has refused the repair under Warranty. They will however be glad to have a tech come out and replace the motherboard at my expense. Yes, I am expected to pay for a Warranty repair?!! A product that has Netflix as a partner is refusing to admit the product failure and finally does but then refuses to make the consumer whole, instead requests I wait two more weeks? It's been broken for almost two months now and Samsung requests I be patience and wait some more. I just want to be made whole so I requested a replacement TV and was refused. Best Buy can't help me out as I did not get a warranty from them so I have a faulty TV and no Netflix, so consumer beware. Samsung will not stand behind the Warranty on this TV if its related to faulty firmware, I need to see the fine print on that one. VERY disappointed in Samsung support and Warranty process.NEVER buy a Samsung product without purchasing Best Buys coverage as I confirmed the Geek squad would have fixed this under warranty with no questions. The second TV I bought has a 5 yr warranty from Best Buy and they will come out and repair that one, no extra charge. Shame on you Samsung for running me in circles for 6 weeks and denying the product is faulty for over 6 weeks. What a mess!

Reviews.Title: Picture isn't that clear
Reviews.Author: mjtaborn
Reviews.Content: The box arrived quickly and in good shape and was easy to set up but the picture quality isn't that good.  We fiddled around with the controls and did our best, but it's just not a good picture.  I'm glad I bought the protection plan - may be using it sooner rather than later, I'm afraid...

Reviews.Title: Ok TV, audio a problem
Reviews.Author: BA in NJ
Reviews.Content: After owning this TV for about a year, we finally seem to have solved the audio problem.With our old TV (not a flat screen) our preferred way of watching was to listen through regular headphones plugged directly into the TV. You can't do that with these new models. I read a lot online to try to solve the problem, and everything seemed to confirm that there was no way to do this.  There is a jack for plugging in headphones BUT because the speakers in the TV are so weak, if you use regular headphones, the sound output is atrocious. You have to turn the volume on the TV all the way down, and you get very weak sound through the headphones, and you can't adjust the volume with the volume control on the headphones. And IF you turn the volume on the TV up, you get sound through the TV speakers and the headphones at the same time, which of course you don't want. (I'm not 100% sure but I think you'd have this same problem with all those TV ears they sell). You have a choice: you can use wireless with an independent power source, or wired, also with an independent power source, and then you can control the volume through the phones. We just got a reasonably priced soundbar at Radio Shack, and that certainly improves the sound quality in general for watching without phones. The only problem with it is that it doesn't have an headphone jack, so we can't plug phones directly into that. Anyway, bottom line, we think we've solved the sound problem for us, but it's too bad that with the LED's the manufacturers can't accommodate people who want to plug in phones and get good sound directly from the TV. One thing for sure, if you're two people in a small apartment, you certainly do NOT need to spend a lot of money to get decent sound from your LED TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Caren
Reviews.Content: Great television, Samsung makes them to last.  Clear picture, lighweight, awesome, used it for a sales contest, brought great results!

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Sammi
Reviews.Content: It is my husband's tv and he seems to like it just fineIt is a tv what more can you expect ?

Reviews.Title: Extremely poor packaging by Samsung
Reviews.Author: Rebecca "tvk"
Reviews.Content: The 2 star is assigned only for the packaging as I was not able toturn unit on - as it arrived with a cracked screen - which was bulging atthe top.  Outside of box showed crease across the area where thetv screen was damaged.  It is startling to see that while in box - thescreen is completely unprotected and the cardboard of box is its onlybarrier from a crushing outside force.  Upon calling Amazon customer service -they were quick to issue an order for return.  What I found unsatisfactory is theysaid they would not issue a refund until unit was returned so they could estimateif it was something I had done or happened while unit was being shipped.  Bottomline, after "some conversation" - they issued a credit and 1 added month of prime shippingto my account.  No replacement could be sent as this unit was out of stock.  I had orderedat the perfect time with purchase price being under $350.  Not sure if I want to orderagain - with such extremely poor packaging.

Reviews.Title: Picture ok, not great
Reviews.Author: Beach Bum
Reviews.Content: The tv works ok but the picture is kinda faded compared to my Panasonic.  Probably wouldn't buy again.  two more

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: cecil cartwright
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set baised on consumer report. I have not been disapointed it replace one that was damaged in the earth quake and  it  worked very good out of the box. I don't think I could find one at a better price and quick delivery

Reviews.Title: Avoid this TV
Reviews.Author: James C. Vogelzang
Reviews.Content: This TV picture is fine when it worked, but it just quit and would not come back on...sound worked, no picture

Reviews.Title: Arrived Damaged
Reviews.Author: David Ferguson
Reviews.Content: Summary indicated that this item was like new. Instead, it was damaged (broken plastic frame) and repackaged. If that had been written in the summary, I would never have purchased it. It was a gift and I didn't ask the receiver to return it.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Phil Bestic
Reviews.Content: I use it to watch CME DVDs from across my small living room. The print and slides was hard to read for my old eyes on a 26 inch screen.

Reviews.Title: Very pleasing to watch this size TV.
Reviews.Author: marilyn j. cole
Reviews.Content: Picture very clear and it is so nice to have it on the wall rather than take up room on a TV stand.  I put my desk underneath the TV and when working at the desk, I can also keep up with a news program on the TV without turning my head.

Reviews.Title: A+ all around
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rivera
Reviews.Content: Awsome tv for the price. Looks really good and sound is important when buying these types of tv's and I'm my opinion samsung always gets it right. There tv's always sound great. Perfect bedroom tv

Reviews.Title: ITS THE CATS MEOW
Reviews.Author: WALTER SCHNEIDERMAN
Reviews.Content: THIS IS NUMBER 5 (SAMSUNG) FOR ME  THEY ARE WITHOUT A DOUBT THE BEST TVS AROUND.  IONLY BUY THE 5 SERIES OR HIGHER  THAT GIVES ME EXTRAS I WANT.  THEY ARE WONDERFUL,

Reviews.Title: Cyber Monday sale
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: Got this for my brother for his new apartment an he loves it, got it at a great deal so every one is happy.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Niya Hsieh
Reviews.Content: Nice and cheaper TV, good quality.It is the thing that I will suggest my friend to buy when they need TV.

Reviews.Title: alright
Reviews.Author: Brandon Powell
Reviews.Content: not bad but not the best it is Samsung's middle model after all.  Thy make good stuff I just always expect more and I usually get it from them.

Reviews.Title: Great gaming TV
Reviews.Author: Joshua L Paige
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for gaming. With its plethora of options for picture tweaking and Game Mode, I couldn't be happier. I have a pretty small room, and this 46" version fits well. It's large, it's pretty and I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Recommend it to others: good buy!
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Good product for the price. Does not have all of the inputs of larger, more expensive sets. The picture quality is very good. The instructions which come with the set are very good on set up; but, a little lacking on use of the set. I am satisfied with the price, quality and speed of delivery from the seller. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: Great picture for the price, what else is there to say. sharp, bright, built quality is just OK, but to the picture quality to price its right.

Reviews.Title: New TV
Reviews.Author: Goldie "jag"
Reviews.Content: HiI just set up my new Samsung 32 inch TV. I have Direct TV so I did not have to purchase the HDTV cable as it works without it.  I am not going to list the good qualities as everything is great.  It was pre-set so the only thing you have to do is turn on.  The only thing I don't like is that I have to use two remotes the one for DTV and the one for the TV. I only gave 4 stars as I was advised very early on by an officer where I worked that there is always room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: samsung un32eh5000 32 inch 1080 led 1080p 60Hz led hdtv black
Reviews.Content: TV is fine after a lot of adjustment. But, Amazon screwed me on getting their Amazon Store Card which allowed 6 months to pay; clicked that link and filled out form only to find that I had signed up for a Chase Card with Amazon logo.  I did not want another Chase card.  Called Amazon and there was nothing that would do to help. I am paying off the bill in one payment and closing the account.  I was a scammed since I did not get the card that I followed on the link and found that I had applied for a Chase card not Amazon Store Card. I believe this was deliberate attempt on Amazon's part or their link was wrong.  I was sent back and forth between Chase and Amazon; last time I think I talked to Chase (not sure) a voice asked me what kind of car I drove, what college I had attended, what the Hell?  All they were after was more information on my personal life.  I answered both questions in the negative and told the voice to shove it.  I that is what you have to do to buy an item from Amazon, then I am off to get my purchases from another means.

Reviews.Title: A piece of junk
Reviews.Author: David Winfield
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV and received it the first week of December 2013 it lasted all of  4 months at which time the screen went blank.  Suggest you choose a different brand this Samsung is a piece of junk! I do have sound, so I guess I could just listen to it like a radio.

Reviews.Title: It's an okay television for the price...
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: PROS: Good picture quality, decent remote, low profile, great price.CONS: Only 2 HDMI ports, poor speakers.You will need an HDMI switch or an AV receiver if you plan to hook more than a couple HD devices to this television.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV several months ago and it has worked just great.  No problems at all.  Very good purchase.  No regrets.

Reviews.Title: jerbear4tv
Reviews.Author: Jerry L. Marshall "tv guy"
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours looking for a new TV for the bedroom.  From all my searching other reviews and actually looking at the displays of TVs atdifferent retailers, the Samsung  UN32EH5000, won hands down.  The picture was great and set up was easy.  The hardest part was getting the cablecompany to do their part.  I didn't change any of the factory settings and the picture was great.  If you have an external amp. and speakers, youmay need a digital/optical converter, as this TV does not support audio.  I had to do this for my system and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV once you calibrate! Here are the settings:
Reviews.Author: Carlos D.
Reviews.Content: I downloaded calibration images and used them to correctly calibrate the TV. It all depends on YOUR lighting and and what not wherever YOU have the TV, but these are the settings that have my TV looking like "real-life":StandardBacklight:  10Contrast: 93Brightness: 61Sharpness: 0Color: 50Tint: 50/50Color Tone: Standard (not warm or cool, standard)Color Space: NativeDynamic Contrast: OFFHDMI Black Levels: LowUnder the "Movie" setting it's all the same except for Brightness : 74TAlso, you have to configure each input, so If you have a Blu-Ray or gaming system plugged in, you have to do the settings under that input as well. Great TV for a great price!

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture and sound
Reviews.Author: isnlohbommu
Reviews.Content: This TV has very clear picture and built in sound. I have had no problems with it at all having computers, DVD players, and game systems connected to it.The only drawback is, when turning on, it feels a little slow.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Adrianne Brandecker
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung flat screen TV.  I now have one in the bedroom and one in the living room.  I am very pleased with the picture quality.  I would definitely recommend Samsung.

Reviews.Title: great price
Reviews.Author: Anthony Stefanini
Reviews.Content: Arrived as indicated excellent picture and best price. this is the second TV we purchased and will purchase another if needed.

Reviews.Title: samsung tv
Reviews.Author: quevg
Reviews.Content: Tv exelent picture  service was very good  would recoment it my friends and any one who is interested in a new TV

Reviews.Title: Nice basic TV
Reviews.Author: M. J. Olan
Reviews.Content: Got this just before 2012 summer Olympics. It arrived the day before the opening ceremony, but unfortunately the screen was broken - box had a minor dent at the point where damage occurred which didn't look significant but manufacturer packaging didn't provide much protection. Very disappointed to say the least. Immediately contacted amazon customer service and within minutes I got an email saying that the replacement was processed and amazingly the new (undamaged) tv arrived less than 24 hours later. Didn't miss a minute of the Olympics! Great service from amazon.As for the TV, this is very basic which is fine for me. Not a wafer-thin LED, but still very light weight and as I understand it, the added depth is used for backlight rather than edge - no sign of flashlighting ever. As my first HD TV, I'm happy and consider it a great value.Minor gripes - the screws supplied for mounting the base to the TV were too short. Fortunately I had some with matching threads and slightly longer which worked fine. Sound is pretty good, but occasionally there is a certain base note that seems to rattle the speaker. I sometimes supplement the speakers with an old mini stereo using the standard audio-out plug. I recall someone saying that this would shut off the built in speakers, but I can run both and balance them to get the sound I want. Its not what discerning ears would consider audiophile quality, but not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: Bought 2 of these.
Reviews.Author: J. England
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of Samsung TVs (and Phones) so this didn't require too much research to decide to make this purchase.  I got one for my daughter to replace her old-school 27" tube, and another one to upgrade my 27" ASUS monitor.The picture quality is great with both my kid's Roku and with my computer.  If you are looking for a bedroom LCD , or a monitor... these aren't a bad option.  Thanks Amazon for super speedy delivery.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but false advertising on box
Reviews.Author: AWags
Reviews.Content: The box my TV came in had "Smart TV" all over it -- which translates to Internet connectivity, apps usage, etc.Well, I just ordered a LinkStick Model WIS12ABGNX so I could connect to the internet, BUT of course, I found out the hard way that this TV doesn't do that.Samsung, do yourself a favor and POST that LinkSticks do not work with this model. I scoured the internet for hours for any sort of article that talks about this model and linksticks, but there are none.Oh yeah, and STOP false advertising on boxes about this model being a "SMART TV".

Reviews.Title: No HDMI cable included
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 TV's and was disappointed to learn that Samsung does not include a HDMI cable with their TV's!

Reviews.Title: samsung 32"LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: We are very satisfied with the TV.  Color, controls (remote), sound all very good. One caveat is one can only turn on and off or switch channels with the remote.  Can't locate any controls on the TV itself.  Am I missing something?  Sincerely, Diana Gazzola

Reviews.Title: Its all about the picture
Reviews.Author: pops
Reviews.Content: We have a Samsung 55" LED with Smart Hub and chose this time to get a TV that had only the features from our experience that we utilized.  This TV combined with the Samsung Blu-Ray player gave what we needed at less cost than  the Smart Hub option, with the ability to play discs.  Quality is same as our previous TV. LED is far superior to LCD.  Good buy!

Reviews.Title: Best led tv
Reviews.Author: EllisCylde pro gamer
Reviews.Content: This TV is an amazing TV for 350 that is unbeatable it has 3500000:1 dynamic contrast ratio 1080p 60hz led hdtv

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40EH5000 120 CMR LED 1080P HDTV
Reviews.Author: Gregory S
Reviews.Content: This 40" TV took me a long time to research and locate.  I saw two very good 40" HDTVs at Sam's Club, but when I would go back to purchase one, they were always sold out.  It is a very good television that fits my 48" wide bookcase very well.  It has a narrow bezel, unlike most 40" TVs, so it would fit into the bookcase with room to spare on each side and the top for ventilation.  It didn't come out of the box with the best adjustment for my application, but with some care and effort, I got it adjusted to look as good as those at Sam's Club looked.  It has an excellent picture with the tweaking that I did, and the menus for doing that are good (not excellent, but good), they are fairly intuitive if you have had experience with such menus.  They are far better than the menus on my 32" Vizio that I replaced with this TV (HDMI connectors all knocked out by lightning strikes), and also on my 42" Panasonic plasma 1080i HDTV.  The picture on this LED Samsung rivals that of the Panasonic plasma set at a fraction of the cost.  The plasma Panasonic has an excellent picture, and this low cost Samsung LED tv is almost as good.  I say almost, because the blacks and the crispness of picture aren't quite as good as the Panasonic.  But considering what I payed for the Panasonic four years ago, the Samsung is by far the better value.  The Panasonic plasmas cost less than half what they used to cost, but still about twice as much as this Samsung.And, the LED tv is only a fraction of the weight of the Panasonic plasma set, and also puts out only a fraction of the heat that the plasma set does.My only negative comment thus far, is that the Samsung set has only two HDMI connectors.  If you have a TiVo or other DVR and a BluRay player, you have used up all of the HDMI connectors and will have to use the RGB component connector for the next device.I highly recommend this TV if it continues to be as good as it is now.  I've used it only one month, and have had only one lightning strike without damage.  The surge protector that I have is supposed to protect the cable connection too, but it doesn't.  In fact, I have to disconnect it because it gives poor digital reception (pixilation is common).

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: James C. Axsom "jcaxsom"
Reviews.Content: It does every thing it said it would do. For the price I thought it would be the thin one, but I got it to fit in the shelving.

Reviews.Title: waste of money!
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: we bought this based on the great reviews but it is HUGE disappointment! we bought it to replace our 3 year old 32" vizio 720p 120hz (which cost only $350 i might add!) and boy were we surprised on the horrible picture quality. it looks great viewed dead on but move slightly to one side or the other and the picture becomes very washed out and muddy. i have tried to tweak all the settings but it still looks horrible. the remote has a very slight delay on functions which is very irritating!the picture quality is so bad that we will be moving this to the guest room and keeping the vizio! a waste of almost $500!

Reviews.Title: Sound Quality is Poor.
Reviews.Author: LibraLove "LibraLove"
Reviews.Content: Light as a feather and almost all plastic, the picture is good, but not as good as my old LCD 20" huge, heavy Samsung or 26" Olevia HD. Sound is weak with little bass or richness.You really need to purchase a separate sound bar. My son says all new LED TVs are like that -- crummy sound. If you like "The Voice", you'll need to add speakers to this TV. In general, it's Ok. I like it.

Reviews.Title: Busted
Reviews.Author: Paul Harris
Reviews.Content: ***********************************************************[Update next day] So I went on youtube, saw two cheap fixes. I tried the easier one. I opened the back (AFTER UNPLUGGING IT) and tried re-seating the cables. Some I could not loosen but I tried pressing them in. And................ my $700 tv works! And I spent zero dollars and only needed a screwdriver. The hint is: if your tv blinks when you smack the top, it could be a loose cable, according to the guy on youtube. Mine blinked, and mine was fixed as I described (for more detail, I first plugged the tv back in and tried tapping each cable to see which one might be loose, the screen didn't flicker. Then I unplugged the tv again and reseated or pressed in every cable I saw, around 7 or 8, and wala!)Also, apparently a lot of the time it is the capacitors, so if yours is broke you might try replacing them (pretty cheap to do yourself). You'll need screwdriver, solder iron, solder sucker, and some capacitors (and some instruction, but it looks quite simple to do). And the back panel should come off easy, if it doesn't then you missed a screw.I may or may not change the one-star. I should note that the tv doesn't get banged around. I do occasssionally rotate it 30 degrees or so. The youtube guy's explanation was temperature changes might loosen things over time) [/update]**********************************************************Bought this June 2012, Today 18 months later it is barely working.Details:On the hdmi computer input, the desktop wallpaper (which takes up the middle third of the screen, displays ok (but doesn't look great). If I trying dragging an application over, I can get it about 25% of the way over, then the screen goes crazy (but if I drag the application back the screen comes back). If I manage to get a video started, it's off and on, with the off being black screen or messed up. I managed to get a full-screen photograph over and it stays on, but the image quality isn't so great. If I zoom in on the photo, the blue sections (that shouldn't be there) get bigger. So I' guessing the screen is okay, it's the parts telling the screen what to display that have gone bad.If I hit the tv remote menu button, i get vertical lines, horizontal lines, or both (and I can't read any menu options, except maybe the bottom line of text.)On the analog tv input: Some channels flicker on and off then stay on, other channels stay black.$700 / 18 months = $39/month, which is probably better than rental places, but rental places are ripoffs. A $700 tv should last more than 18 months.

Reviews.Title: Cracked
Reviews.Author: Brent
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to give this item to a special person as a gift. I drove 4 hours to give it to this person as a birthday gift and when I hooked it all up then plugged it in, the pixels on the TV was completely shattered. Very upsetting. I ended up going to the store and purchasing a new one for more money, but it was worth it because I did not want to take the chance of getting another damaged item.

A friend found this very same Samsung UN40EH5000 but in 39" on Groupon for $311.00 the day after my purchase.  I did not cancel this order then do the purchase on Groupon.  Anyway, Samsung has a new tv out called the Curve..........hmmmmm.  YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR  -  HOPEFULLY.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the quality for the price.  I will be getting another T.V  for our extra room.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied; would buy again!
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: I was very wary of the negative reviews prior to purchasing this TV (which is in use as my PC monitor as I write this).  No bad pixels after a couple days of use, and it works fine.  Christopher Engel wrote a great review that has brilliant settings for it.  With those implemented, the picture is great and what little I've heard of the audio is nothing to complain about.  Also, the power saving options are okay, but what's really nice is the ability to set up three different picture presets (Dynamic, Standard and Movie, from what I've seen) which allows for a high-quality preset (for my Xbox) and a power saving preset for my PC.My version number is UU02, I believe.  Not listed on any of the bad reviews, so I don't know if it's a Samsung panel.Either way, using it with both a PC and an Xbox 360 has yielded the hoped for results and had a great, under-$300 price.  I would buy it again, so don't be deterred by those poor reviews.  The issues have likely been rectified, it seems.

Reviews.Title: Great item Great Value!

Reviews.Content: Very good item and it is a Great Value. I would definitely order this again and definitely recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size and picture

Reviews.Title: The TV on the Market

Reviews.Content: We have two Samsungs,the picture on both the 46" and the 32" are far superior to most I've seen for the money..

Reviews.Title: great tv

Reviews.Title: Needed a straight-forward TV for the guest bedroom

It fits beautifully in the space provided, there is virtually no glare even though there is a picture window at a 30 degree angle to it, and it is very simple to operate.Also, I can connect my old-school video games to it and my state-of-the art PC for when I want to see how my presentations will look on a bigger screen. Reviews.Title: Best TV I have owned

Reviews.Content: This was a Black Friday purchase last November at a great price. I am really happy with this TV. It is bright and very clear. The colors and contrast are great. This is my first LED TV so perhaps that is the reason for the excellent picture quality that is a lot better than my plasma TVs. I have this set in my home-office on the wall in front of my desk. It is hooked up to my computer via HDMI so I can use it like a second monitor and also run a slide show of photos or pick the photo of the day to display on the TV. Imagine a painting that I can change at will. The images are amazing and far better than the other TV's I have set up like this. I am likely to buy another one of these TVs if I can ever duplicate my Black Friday price. Prices have come down so this may be pretty soon.

Reviews.Title: nice price!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME

Reviews.Content: Really impressed with this tv. Everything you would want in a flatscreen. I owned a panisonic veria totally sucked!! Plus they never backed up their product.Samsung really kicked ASS!!!!!!!!! Love shopping at AMAZON!!!!!!!!! You ROCK!!!!!!!! I have never been disappointed buying from AMAZON. THANK YOU!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Out of Tune
Reviews.Author: Keith Otis Edwards "Keith Otis Edwards"
Reviews.Content: If, like most people, you subscribe to cable service, skip this review, because it will not apply to you.If, however, rely on broadcast transmission from separate TV stations, this is a very poor product. If you know anything about how televisions operate, or at least think about it for a moment, you know'll know that inside every TV or radio there are separate components that do specific jobs -- just like your car. For instance, there is an audio amplifier and speakers to handle the sound portion of the programming. Those components have nothing to do with the video portion of the signal.To convert broadcast radio waves, every receiver (TV or radio) has a tuner -- a tuning section. If you are getting your signal through the pipe, you don't need this, so Samsung has apparently skimped on the design and reliability of the tuners in their sets, because most people don't need this component.I have an old, tall house with a rotating antenna on the roof, and since I purchased a Samsung, channels suddenly and completely drop out. Not merely during inclement weather, but for weeks at a time.  For a while, I couldn't get Channel 2, no matter what position I rotated the antenna to.  Then, Channel 4 became a problem. I switched to an amplified indoor antenna, but with no change in the results, so my diagnosis points to the Samsung's tuner. A friend of mine also purchased a Samsung, and he has the same problem. Channels come and go, but his missing channels are different than mine.The LED picture is good enough, I guess, and I often watch HD programming on it through my Apple TV, but for broadcast TV, it's the worst set I've ever owned. Samsung has obviously skimped and put a piece-of-junk tuner in their sets.It's a cheap set, so whaddya 'spek.

Reviews.Title: Good size for bedroom
Reviews.Author: Lee A Jorgensen
Reviews.Content: Christmas Present for Wife. This is a set for her bedroom. Just the right size. Easy set-up and connection to Dish..

The picture is nice and the color is great but I own a Plasma tv and this LED tv can't match the still pictures or the lack of pixeling by my plasma. I placed this TV in my bedroom and it is a great second tv. Overall I give this tv four stars.
