Reviews.Title: Does not reconize AV input.. and .. ONLY 60Hz!!!
Reviews.Author: Donald Peterson "White Buffalo"
Reviews.Content: Does not recognize AV , If you don't have an HDMI device to use then forget it!!I spent hours wondering what I was doing wrong and finally figured that it just don't work!! It is only a 60Hz TV or so the box tells me.. Somehow Amazon is getting away with telling us it is a 120Hz TV ---  NOT TRUE !! what it really is is a 120 CMR (Clear Motion Rate). More info here on CMR ... ..  [...]Okay after trying three different inputs ( Two different portable DVD players and my PS3 ) all that didn't work. I tried a very old portable DVD player that works! what is up with that? All the other three do not work. and the TV does not recognize any of them.. But does recognize the old Phillips portable DVD player.. GRRRRR

Reviews.Title: Please help!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Parker
Reviews.Content: I have 2 other Samsung flat-screens, a 32" LED & a 40" LCD. The 40" is 7 yrs old and is still going strong. They both have amazing pictures. In my opinion, Samsung has the best picture in TVs. I setup my new 50" and the picture is very good. I used the plastic stand that comes with it. I'm also using a TV stand with a glass top. The TV leans to the back about 3". I removed the stand and and put it back on (thinking I may have not put it on correctly) and it still leans to the back. I put a level on the glass top TV stand and it reads level. I then contact Samsung and explain to them what its doing. They said it definitely should not lean front or back. It should be completely vertical. I then contact Amazon and they send me a replacement. And guess what? This one does the exact same thing. Is this normal? My other 2 Samsung's do not lean either way. I did check to see how sturdy the TV is and it does seem sturdy. Do I just live with it? Do I take a chance on a 3rd unit? Do I swap out for a different model? Thanks in advance!

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Judi Blanchard
Reviews.Content: this is the best site I have purchased in years - I reviewed consumer report before the purchase and this one filled the bill - great color, contrast and all I hoped for and more

Reviews.Title: Serves my needs
Reviews.Author: Marc O'Polo
Reviews.Content: I have rated this unit four stars only because of limited use so far. I fully expect this to be a 5-star purchase.I needed a relatively small flat-panel TV for my bedroom. I have a Samsung LCD in my family room and have been pleased with it. (No problems so far after five years of use.) Consumer Reports and reviews here on Amazon steered me once again to Samsung.This 32-inch model was a snap to unpack and set up. The stand is sturdy; it's held in place with self-tapping screws. I make sure to cinch down each screw as I proceed; I find this avoids problems down the road.The unit is plug-and-play. Connect it to a power outlet and a cable jack. Power it up, and it goes into an interactive guided process for setting the various parameters, including scanning for available channels.After the plug-and-play process was complete, I tweaked a couple of the settings through the menu to satisfy my preferences for screen brightness and sound quality. As with any LCD TV, sound quality leaves a lot to be desired. But I find this unit is adequate for the location in which I've placed it and the somewhat limited use it will be receiving.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 50 inch led 1080p 120hz
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: Is a great item looks great as well works great it uses almost no light prefect for u to save money and want a great tv 10 Dollers a year great deal one best item I have gotten

Reviews.Title: Nice set, but missing some very basic things.
Reviews.Author: Fox "Lunatic"
Reviews.Content: It's got a beautiful picture, I kinda wish I'd paid a little more and gotten a larger one, 32 inches is just...kinda puny. Otherwise my only real complaint is the lack of useful component ports. Two HDMI ports? Really samsung? Way to cheap out. But the screen makes it worth that annoyance, mostly. I'd give it 5 stars if you put another HDMI port on it, and let it talk to my external HD instead of just a stupid flash drive.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5000 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Timothy S.
Reviews.Content: The "Samsung UN32EH5000 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV" was a perfect choice. The image quality is amazingly good when it comes to watching a blue ray, playing your favorite video game, or even just simply watching TV. The 32" slim edged high quality TV  is perfect for all bedrooms and living spaces. Many of Special features like the "Clear Motion 120 rate" are reasons this Samsung TV is worth it!!!!!  Life like motion experience is watching Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40" (replacement)
Reviews.Author: m m smits
Reviews.Content: *** UPDATE 8/15/12 ***  (Original review moved to the bottom.)Received my replacement yesterday, and we have success!  Finally, the 4th TV in 20 days (2nd Samsung) works without any issue!  Couldn't be happier.  Now, for a 'real' review of the actual TV.Before I go over the details, let me go over my setup.  This is important because it explains why I rate this TV the way I did.- Samsung UN40EH5000 40" LED TV- Onkyo HT-RC360  A/V receiver- Sony BDP-S480 Blueray Disc (BD) player- Apple TV (2nd gen)- Acer Windows 7 Media Center PC- Nintendo Wii(And a Magnavox VCR/DVD recorder to copy some of my old tapes to DVD)The receiver, BD player, Apple TV, Wii and PC are all networked.  I don't have cable - instead I have an array of three antennae in my attic: a long-range UHF, a long-range VHF, and a mid-range omnidirectional VHF/UHF.  Combiners send the signal to an amplifier in the basement where most components are housed in an air-cooled cabinet (all except the TV and BD player, which are in the TV room).1 - Connections.  This TV has limited connections.  This is important if you have a lot of components you want to connect.  For example, my setup wouldn't work without the receiver.  Having said that, I have no issues since I use the receiver as the source selector.  In all honesty, I would have been fine if this were just a monitor, e.g. no TV tuner, as I use the media PC for TV watching.  But these things are less expensive with a tuner than without.  Go figure.  The one thing it doesn't have that I was slightly disappointed about was the lack of HDMI ARC (Audio Return Channel), which means that if I do want to watch live TV and listen to surround sound, I have to use the optical cable.  Not a huge deal, but if you want to have the cables in the wall you'll have to fish one as Leviton doesn't make a plug-in SP/DIF plug.  Since I watch TV from my media PC it's not a big enough deal to take points off.2 - Features.  What features?  Aside from being able to play off a USB stick and an amazing array of picture adjustment options, there really are no features.  No streaming, no browser, no AirPlay.  But again, that's perfect for my setup.  I use Apple TV for Netflix and iTunes, the Sony BD player for Vudu and Amazon On Demand (and a wide array of other streaming services), and my Media PC for live TV and recorded TV.  Consider this a 40" monitor with a tuner, not a one-stop media device.3 - Picture quality.  This one's kind of tough because there are so many settings, it can be time consuming finding the best quality.  The TV's Energy Star rating says it'll use $7 a year, but that's with all the Eco settings.  I have found that most of those make the picture quite dark.  So I'm still trying to tweak the screen to give me the color and brightness I want but also keep the energy costs down - the whole point behind an LED TV.  I may have to invest in a test BD, but I'll try a little longer.  Bottom line is that I'm sure I can find a happy medium as there are a plethora of settings you can adjust.As other reviewers have said, this is not a 120Hz TV.  I didn't think that would be an issue, but you'd be surprised.  Even fast action in a movie will show motion blur.  There's a setting to reduce this, but it also makes the screen darker.  Again, it will take tweaking.4 - Design.  It's not as thin as other LED TVs.  On the other hand, as a result, it seems to be more sturdy than other TVs.  As indicated above, I first tried a pair of TCL TVs.  These are absolutely gorgeous, with minimal bezels and a very thin design.  Both had busted screens.  The first Samsung had an issue as well, but it seemed to me it was just because of a pair of main board mounts that were driven into the screen from behind.  I specifically wanted a slightly thicker TV to make sure it wouldn't be broken during manufacturing or shipping.  The bezel is still rather slim.  I have mine wall mounted and haven't even taken the stand out of the plastic.  And it's amazingly light, weighing less than 20 lbs without the stand.5 - Audio.  I really can't comment, as one of the first things I did was turn of the internal speakers.  Check other reviews for audio properties.6 - Overall.  My previous TV was a 32" Olevia (532) that had worked fine for 5+ years.  But it was getting tired, and we watch enough movies that we wanted something bigger.  My TV room is a small space, with eyes about 8' from the screen.  I could have gone 46", but there really was no need.  Despite what US advertising makes you think, bigger is not always better.  After only one day I'm very pleased with my choice, and if you have an AV receiver or only 2 video sources, you will be too.  I upgraded my rating to 5 stars as it does exactly what it said it would.--------------Original Review:I had trouble finding a title. See, this is the 3rd TV I got from Amazon in 2 weeks. First I got a TCL 42". That had a busted screen (not visible until it was on). Then I got a replacement for that, same model, different problem but also busted. See my other reviews for details.I didn't want to try a 3rd TCL, so I went with a 'reputable' brand. So much for that idea. This one has two spots in the center of the screen that are unlit. I'll upload a picture so you can see what I mean. So, it's going back for replacement - which will be TV # 4. I'm starting to get a feeling either I'm just incredibly unlucky, or Amazon only sells grade B products.I rated it 4 stars because it may just be a fluke. I'm supposed to get my replacement next Tuesday and will update this review afterwards. If TV # 4 is bad as well, it'll become a 1 star review and I will stick with my 32" Olevia untill it dies, because I can't keep doing this.

Reviews.Title: NOT MEANT TO BE USED FOR A COMPUTER MONITOR!!!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Yu
Reviews.Content: So I just received my tv today and first thing I did was hook it up to my computer because I bought it as a replacement for a broken Dynex 32" 720p TV which I used as a monitor. (Occasionally Used For Over The Air Digital Channels) Since I have an AMD HD6970 graphics card running in my tower, it automatically changed the output screen resolution to 1080p which is where this tv DOES NOT PERFORM WELL. All the lettering is fuzzy no matter how I changed the settings on my computer and the TV. The only way I could get the lettering to be clear and detailed was to reduce the resolution to 1600 x 900. I have no problem with the 1600 x 900 resolution however, I did pay $420 for this tv and had hoped it would compare well with the 55" Sony I have in the living room which my tower can plug into and go 1080p with awesome clarity (Even Though My Parents Paid $1.5k for the Sony). The picture quality does need tweaking and I followed (for the most part) the setup of the guy who wrote the most viewed post. Overall this TV is super lightweight which was one of the main reasons I bought it since my desk has been tilted due to the 25lb weight of the Dynex TV I recently trashed. It's a good buy for the most part and when the time comes for me to move out of my parent's house, this would most likely become my main TV and I will buy an actual monitor for my computing needs.

Reviews.Title: It's not for the living room.
Reviews.Author: mmdetloff
Reviews.Content: It's a great high performance TV, but not really good for the living room. It has great features with the sound, but really, the size is too small to be in your main viewing area, as I ordered it for. I probably wouldn't order this again, in this size, but since we work in the movie industry and don't really watch TV, it works fine for us.

Reviews.Title: Not please
Reviews.Author: Zonnette Watts
Reviews.Content: Wasn't please the stand connect to the flat screen tv was defective. I spoke with someone who could not assist me.

Reviews.Title: Great -- Bought a 2nd one for our bedroom
Reviews.Author: Lew, Haddonfield NJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung 40" model about 3 years ago for our family room, which is of moderate size.  In our area we are fortunate to have Verizon FiOS, which brings out the full quality of the picture.  Since we got the HD TV we watch television much more than before.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5000 32-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Judie Coe "Diane"
Reviews.Content: It has a good picture, is the size I wanted to have a set that was larger than the first (26") screen I had.

Reviews.Title: picture quality good, movies are a little distorted, proportionally
Reviews.Author: N. Williams
Reviews.Content: No complaints, really, except it doesn't seem like these dimensions are perfect for watching movies.  That may be true for many other TVs, too, but I thought I'd mention.  After training ourselves in its use, the remote functions fine and isn't too difficult to use.

Reviews.Title: Picture is grainy.
Reviews.Author: Linda I. Lawrence
Reviews.Content: Had this for nearly two months, and still can't get a good clear picture on it.  Maybe it's my satellite connection, but our TV in the living room is  just fine.

Reviews.Title: It has been great so far
Reviews.Author: al-in-nj
Reviews.Content: So far, I am happy with this TV. It was easy to install and set up. The picture is very good.

Reviews.Title: A deal value for the price
Reviews.Author: Eli-Ron Aminov
Reviews.Content: I got TV when it was 280 for cyber Monday, for the price its a great deal.Other wise its very standard...

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: Dave2001
Reviews.Content: Picture quality was less than impressive. I've have a Samsung plasma, now several years old, which has a much superior picture and viewing angle.

Reviews.Title: Happy Holidays
Reviews.Author: Zakiya Williams
Reviews.Content: This is a holiday gift to myself.  It arrived as promised.  I was able to track the package easily.  I wish I knew and eta on time.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: gretchen stoeppelwerth
Reviews.Content: Love it but the volume control is not user friendly.  The lady from Comcast took over a half hour to get us connected but we persevered!

Reviews.Title: fast
Reviews.Author: Lark
Reviews.Content: and delivered to my home in perfect condition and at very competitive price as well. Only wish i could buy another bigger one too.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Philly Minx
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with it.  Lots of HDMI issues to address at first but this is also my first HD TV so all in all, no biggie.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in the product
Reviews.Author: Husker Fan
Reviews.Content: The television does not sit on the stand correctly.  It leans backwards and also seems to slant to the left.  This is supposedly a quality product.  We are ready to return it to get our money back.

Reviews.Title: I don't like it
Reviews.Author: Regina Rothlein
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the clarity and color.  I had my cable/HD provider come out to see if the color could be adjusted, but no, it appears to be the TV itself.  My previous TV was mush better.

Reviews.Title: good price but missing some features
Reviews.Author: Dan Moy "dmoy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because I was impressed by what I saw at the nearby electronics/appliance store.  The price advertised for this product was 35% lower than the local store.  The product was delivered very quickly (sooner than projected).  However, the tv model was not exactly as advertised.  This version has some features disabled which may explain the lower price.  However, given the lower price, I can live without the missing features.  Sound and picture is great.

Reviews.Title: No HEADPHONE jack!
Reviews.Author: D. Barrett
Reviews.Content: I unpackaged the TV, tested it, mounted it to the wall of my exercise room, and went to plug in my headphones... and there was no jack! I can't return the TV because I've screwed a wall-mount into the back, so it no longer looks new.  I am pissed at Samsung for being cheap and not including a headphone jack.To solve the problem, I pulled an old amplifier out of the closet, hooked it up to the audio output, and connected my headphones to it.  Not a great solution because the TV remote does not control the volume -- it requires a separate remote -- and I have to manually set the TV volume to zero when using the headphones. Annoying.Strangely, I can't get any sound out of the RCA pair of audio outs. I had to use the mini-jack audio out. (If only this jack had a volume control, it could serve as a headphone jack. Sigh.)

Reviews.Title: Returned Samsung UN32EH5000 32-INCH
Reviews.Author: Barbara C. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Color absolutely would not adjust to decent level.  Colors remained muddy, picture shadowy.  Would not sharpen up.  Tried adjusting for many hours over a 2-day period, and finally said, "This thing is crap" and packaged it up to return.  Had to pay for the UPS pick-up fee, plus shipping cost, pay a "restock" fee-, then call them with the UPS Tracking Number.  Talked to 2 separate women for the initial RMA Number (which you must have for returns) and had great difficulty understanding (or hearing) either one of them.  So my taking advantage of the Memorial Day sale turned into a costly disaster.  I'll certainly never purchase anything by Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Very poor
Reviews.Author: Mats D. Wichmann
Reviews.Content: There's really only one thing that matters for the TV: picture quality.  This TV came with a version code of HS03, which means it's not a Samsung panel, apparently (see elsewhere in reviews).  No amount of twiddling has come anywhere near an acceptable picture, so it's going back. Part of the problem seems to be the very matte screen surface which diffuses things in unexpected ways.  Having said nothing else matters, a couple more niggles - these would not have been enough to send it back and would just have remained irritants.  The stand does not swivel, which we need to avoid dragging the base on the surface on which it sits. The base is also extremely lightweight, leaving us quite nervous it could tip over easily. Can't do anything to anchor it, because we do have to turn the whole TV for certain uses (see swivel complaint). And for a TV which is not hung on a wall and has a uniform background, but stands on a piece of furniture, it's much easier on the eye if the TV itself has some borders to make a visual separation between the picture and the room background.  This TV (apparently in common with all current models, so this not particularly specific to this model) has essentially no borders.  That made a surprising difference in comfort compared to the previous LCD TV of the same screen size (also a Samsung - LN-T4065F).  Samsung has cut back on connection ports, which has been noted elsewhere and we knew going in - but just two HDMI ports is kind of niggly in a day when just about everything, including notebook computers, now comes with an HDMI port; the older model had three, which turned out just right for our uses.

Reviews.Title: above average
Reviews.Author: jk "John"
Reviews.Content: bought this tv a month and a half ago and still tweaking the settings. Primary gamer and my xbox is connected with an hdmi cable and the reference level is set to standard. here they are, i would like some feedback thanks.Mode: StandardBacklight: 19Contrast: 93Brightness: 47Sharpness: 4Color: 49Tint (G/R): G53/R47Advanced Settings:Color Space: AutoWhite Balance  R-Offset 23  G-Offset 25  B-Offset 25  R-Gain  0  G-Gain  30  B-Gain  30Gamma: 0Dynamic Contrast: LowBlack Tone: offFlesh Tone: 0Motion Lighting: 0ffPicture OptionsColor Tone: StandardDigital Noise Filter: AutoHDMI Black Level: LowLED Motion Plus: off

Reviews.Title: Very attractive TV
Reviews.Author: Jim D.
Reviews.Content: I bought the Samsung unit to upgrade from a 20+ year old Zenith.The picture on my Zenith is just as good as the new unit - much smaller though.  I have noticed that  small print is distorted.Overall I would rate it as a big OK.

Reviews.Title: easy
Reviews.Author: Michael Petek
Reviews.Content: easy to use out of the box. great picture.great price. great brand. works well with laptop. I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for a good price
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I love this tv, it came with everything needed and works well with my xbox. No complaints here. ha ha

Reviews.Title: 32 inch samsung tv
Reviews.Author: Zeta Olander
Reviews.Content: Color wasnt as vibrant as I would have liked. Shipping and install very easy. Next time I will buy a larger tv

Reviews.Title: Dead on arrival
Reviews.Author: Edwin Thomas
Reviews.Content: Unit arrived defective.  Turns on and off but displays no picture.  Plan to return for replacement and hope for better luck next time.

Reviews.Title: I kept it for the price.
Reviews.Author: Me "Me"
Reviews.Content: Although it seems to be a general trend for all TVs, the base for this one is horrible.  You must lay your TV "face-down" in order to screw the base in place.  Once on, the base feels "delicate" (flimsy?).  My 7-year-old LG has a heavy, solid base onto which the TV simply slides.  This design is poor.  Mine is wall-mounted.I bought the TV b/c I thought it was "full-array".  Thus, it would not have the problems of other LED-lit models.  That's not the case.  There's a definite banding which can be visible for very dark scenes.  Also, the viewing angle is not good.  The image "washes out" when you're out of a ~40-degree angle.  I'm 15+ feet away, and have no issue with this.Hopefully, it will last until OLED panels are cheap.  :)Update:  Panel code CH01, not even made by Samsung, according to other reviewer.

Reviews.Title: Missing stand
Reviews.Author: CARL F
Reviews.Content: This TV was missing the stand.  I bought it for a gift for someone so I did not open the package and the person I gave it to did not open the package until after the return window had expired.  Now they are stuck with a TV with no stand.  I have had a lot of problems like this with Amazon lately: DVDs are scratched, defect products, parts missing.  You really need to inspect everything from Amazon closely upon receipt or you wind up stuck with junk.

Reviews.Title: Awful unit
Reviews.Author: toelone
Reviews.Content: Amazon shouldn't be selling this TV.  It is a terrible unit -- looks awful, sounds awful, functions awful.  It's not defective it's just of poor quality.  I can't say enough bad things about it.  I am surprised that this unit would be sold at all by Amazon.  Just a piece of junk.  Shortly after I bought it they stopped carrying it.  I would not buy a TV from Amazon again.  They play around with which items they sell and prices too quickly and then run out of stock or switch to a new model too quickly.  You never know what you will get.  In this case I got a very unimpressive unit that I am very disappointed with for not a very good price.  Better to go to your local big box.

Reviews.Title: help
Reviews.Author: Ash
Reviews.Content: i just this tv today, and i cant find out how to set upps2 or ps3 to it.any one know how?please reply

Reviews.Title: Gripping Insighful Realism
Reviews.Author: J Anson
Reviews.Content: Cast perfectly with enough humor in all the cynicism to make this 5 stars.Iceland or anywhere, it is well filmed all the way around.

Reviews.Title: SCREWED BY SAMSUNG?
Reviews.Author: John M. Simpson "USC TROJAN"
Reviews.Content: HAVEN'T HAD A CHANCE TO PLUG IT IN AS SOMEONE THREW AWAY THE FOAM PIECE ON TOP OF THE TV/THE EIGHT SCREWS(REPLACEMENT COST $26) FOR THE STAND WERE STUCK INTO THE FOAM.  FIRST SAMSUNG SAID THEY WOULD REPLACE THEM/THEN THEY CALLED BACK AND SAID THEY WOULD NOT/THUS $26 MORE DOLLARS FOR EIGHT LITTLE SCREWS/ONE FEELS SCREWED AND IT TOOK WEEKS TO BE RESOLVED.  QUESTION-WHO WOULD LOOK IN A LARGE PIECE OF FOAM FOR 8 LITTLE SCREWS?

Reviews.Title: Feature rich and great screen but add a wireless headset...
Reviews.Author: lmc
Reviews.Content: Samsung make such great TVs but sometimes audio is not as great as it could be. I added Sennheiser wireless headphones to take my TV experience to the ultimate level. Now I have a fantastic audio experience and late at night I can have it "turned-up" without bothering anyone else in the house.I use the Sennheiser RS120 headphones as they have super sound and the charging cradle makes them very convenient.B0001FTVEK

Reviews.Title: smart TV connectivity is weak
Reviews.Author: nickel
Reviews.Content: TV purchased approx. 7 months ago.  Tried to  connect it to my local network 2 weeks ago without success.  Informed by Samsung tech rep that I needed to purchase a more current router.  Bought Cisco twin band wireless unit and it connects fine with 2PC's, one netbook, an iPad and an HP printer.  NOT with Samsung smart TV....  Told today by different Samsung tech rep that router needs to be in same room as TV and within 10-15 feet.  Really is the network card that bad?  There's nothing in setup doco that suggests this limitation. Tech recommended that I purchase a network booster.  Good money after bad?Sad state of affairs when an expensive smart TV has worse connectivity than an inexpensive netbook.

Reviews.Title: Need receipt for repair
Reviews.Author: sandra a straley
Reviews.Content: Tv doesn;t work and still nder contract; is it possible to be a copy of my receipt for this tv as proff of purchase for repair; thank you for any hlep you can give me

Reviews.Title: i like it for the money
Reviews.Author: M. M "M M"
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV yesterday. Gorgeous picture, decent sound. for the record, I'm the sort that likes Bose, Bang and Olufsen and Harman Kardon. I liked JBL's MUCH more before they started making them in China with garbage components and now you MUST have a separate sub to do low end or drums. I can't STAND any vibrations due to bass overload. The first movie I played on it was Wall-e in Blu-ray. Very nice. The sound ONLY overloads with heavy bass frequencies at 100% volume. And it's very slight. Most people in most applications would not need more. I would like more RCA plugs for more sound outputs. As it seems now, I think you have to either use a receiver or the headphone jack (NO-bad connection-not worth it). It has a decent weight. I note that old stuff always weighs a ton, and it's often worth refurbishing. Plus, heavy stuff doesn't get knocked over as easy. This has some weight. Some at the store were WAY too light. I bought it for my kitchen when I'm cooking. You don't want hideously expensive for that app, because it WILL get grease on it eventually. Unless you keep after it religiously, it becomes very hard to remove. I had a Bose wave radio in the kitchen for many years. Mine was open box, so no instructions. I'm no electronics engineer, but I really didn't need them. I had it up in literally a few minutes.  I thought about a massive 55 inch one, but that's serious kitchen overkill. I'm very happy with this, definitely worth the price. Now I have to replace all my DVDs, as they're slightly flawed in comparison.

Reviews.Title: horrible don't buy! !
Reviews.Author: Kayla L
Reviews.Content: I ordered a 46 inch but I got a 40 inch instead. AND I went through all the trouble of setting it up and the stand makes it stand lop sided and the speakers didn't work after 15 mins of watching tv. Horrible. Worse $558 ever spent.

Reviews.Title: not as good as an LCD
Reviews.Author: S. Kehoe
Reviews.Content: I HAVE THREE SAMSUNG TVS.  TWO LCDS AND ONE LED.  TWO PERFECT LCDS AND ONE VERY AVERAGE LED.  THE  LED PICTURE IS NOT SHARP AND IS DIM.  THE STAND DOES NOT SWIVEL AND THE WHOLE TV, STAND AND MONITOR MUST BE TURNED TO ACCOMMODATE VIEWING.  POOR DESIGN AND A CHEEP LOOKING FRAME.  MUST BE A TRANSITION SET.  PURCHASED FROM AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: Samsung un32eh5000 32-inch led hdtv not worth buying for the money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: dave capoccitti
Reviews.Content: This tv is not what I wanted and has only one hdmi hook up and that hook up is on the side of the tv not good at all! ,will think twice before ever buying tvs from AMAZON !!!!!!!!!!!!!! I GOT RIPPED OFF!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! VERY UNHAPPY!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not thrilled...
Reviews.Author: Genuwine "JH"
Reviews.Content: Got rid of my sonny flat screen CRT and feel the picture is not as good...the cable guy agreed with me.  This HD madness is a bit much and not very attractive for those over 30...you know what I mean? Who wants to see every imperfection????

Reviews.Title: returns
Reviews.Author: rusty
Reviews.Content: Just got off the phone with Robert the customer services person with Pro Millions.. And with out hesitation he told me how sorry he was on be half of Pro Millions that this has happened. And with any future reservations that my money were on the way back to my account... Thanks Pro Millions for taking care of your customers in a way that we don't get much anymore... I will do business with u in the ditches and thank u for your speedy response... Rusty... satisfied customers ...

Reviews.Title: Incroyable!
Reviews.Author: Glass_Rabbit "...z(O_o)Z..."
Reviews.Content: This TV is so AWESOME that real life looks dull. The picture is so clear that I actually sat through a commercial between channels (Ha, I lied! Only half a commercial. You think I'm made of time, punk?). The image is so bright that it's like staring at the sun. And the sound is so average that it's like, "Meh? Someone dropped the ball here. Fire Smith!" Hell, I'm not even French and the first time I watched a blu-ray 1080p on this thing all I could say was, "Incroyable!" OK, maybe I'm no expert. My previous TV was one of those square boxy thingies. But still... INCROYABLE!!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Tv
Reviews.Author: newshopper
Reviews.Content: THIS TV IS THE WORST FLATSCREEN THAT I HAVE IN MY HOUSE. THE PICTURE QUALITY IS LOUSY; THE PICTURE SIZE CANNOT BE REGULATED AND THE SOUND DOES THE MATCH THE MOVEMENT OF THE LIPS OF THE PICTURE. I HAVE A LARGE SAMSUNG AND IT IS PERFECT. I REGRET THIS PURCHASE AND SPENDING $400 ON THIS PIECE OF JUNK. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS TV; SAVE YOUR MONEY BUY ANOTHER BRAND THAT IS CHEAPER.

Reviews.Title: Picture is Good, Other Features Not so Much
Reviews.Author: William S. Yeargin
Reviews.Content: First of all, I does not have a component and a composite input.  It has a component input with a composite if your not using the component.  Witch is NOT what it says in any of the specs and what not.  That was probably the only thing about the actual product that made me really upset.  Also, and this is just an also, it does not swivel, witch is something I like to have in a TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Ken Searles
Reviews.Content: No internet plug or wifi, but other than that issue it looks like a great tv. I did not even turn it on. I returned it because I am looking for a SMART TV.

Reviews.Title: I do not want to recommend this to anyone.
Reviews.Author: WONSIK JEONG
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed because I wanted options.Do not see my mistake.I do not want to recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Damaged x2
Reviews.Author: Dan Kruse
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV for a Christmas gift.  When the first TV arrived bia FedEx, we noticed 2 big holes in the box.  When the box was opened.  The back of the TV was smashed.  We opted to get a replacement,  which took 2 weeks.  When this TV arrived, you guessed it. Hole in the box.  Plugged it in, and it looked like someone took a baseball bat to the poctur, exactly where the hole was in the box.  Returned this TV, and are still awaiting a refund.

Reviews.Title: Item delivered on time
Reviews.Author: Robert McDonald
Reviews.Content: The item arrived quicker even after not having to pay shipping and handling. I haven't set it up yet and will leave more feedback when I have it setup and tested.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Michael Scott Nation
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed with Amazon on this purchase. I waited 3 months for the price discount on this TV, and believed that the $649.00 price was for a NEW TV - not a refurbished or damaged unit. Considering that the TV arrived 5 days later than scheduled, I am absolutely sure that this Samsung TV was previously delivered elsewhere. The Samsung TV arrived via UPS, the box as crushed on each side with perforations which damaged the rear panel of the TV inside. This should have been noticed at the Chicago Amazon warehouse (as that was where it was shipped from). Additionally, the TV box seems to have been dragged around a lot as the bottom of the box was wet and severely damaged, with major scuff marks. Additionally, it seems that some repair may have been done on this TV as the screws holding the rear panel was loose (not screwed in tight). After I contacted Amazon for a replacement, and advised them of the damage, they identified that they had no more in stock and was not willing to have a replacement shipped from a re-seller. I presume that since they could not match the price at $649.00 they were unwilling to do what is best to retain their customers. I am appalled at Amazon's poor customer service and will no longer retain them as my primary merchant!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: This shipment was damaged upon arrival.  The box was damaged which resulted in the TV screen being damaged.  I had to return the product and have not yet recieved my refund.  I am very dissapointed with this purchase and resulting return which yet has not be refunded.

Reviews.Title: How is the TV supposed to look?
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: Just got my TV, and it looks slightly different than the pictures here on Amazon. I am wondering if anyone else has a similar TV with the same specs, but slightly different looking TV as well. The one I was shipped does not look like the ones advertised [...], but instead like this: [...] The only difference I can see without opening it is that the Samsung logo is not on the little protruding ledge and the TV border is overall a little chunkier. It's not a huge deal if the TV is the same inside, but it would be nice to know if I am not the only one seeing this difference.

Reviews.Title: Piece of garbage
Reviews.Author: Louise Fritzinger
Reviews.Content: Had to return after only having it for 2 weeks. Very disappointed with tv. Never again. Was Christmas gift. Junk

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: Jessica Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I received this TV and it was smaller in the box. I returned it and received no money back in my bank account still to this day.. very disappointed that I cant even send the seller a concerned message. would not recommend this for anyone.. now im out 400 bucks..

Reviews.Title: I am done with Samsung
Reviews.Author: krishna
Reviews.Content: I bought Samsung lnc55 series, died in 16 moths, repaired and again out in two years. My 1300 dollar in trash. I am going with another brand probably Sony. No more Samsung for me

Reviews.Title: Good TV, no problems, easy to set up and use.
Reviews.Author: Briar Lee Mitchell
Reviews.Content: No problems with this TV. Good picture easy to switch back and forth between HD and regular viewing depending on the show you are watching. Took me about 5 minutes to unpack and have it set up.

Reviews.Title: Feedback for samsung 32 inch t.v.
Reviews.Author: Margie Garcia
Reviews.Content: It came pretty quickly, and it is a nice t.v. It was for my son and he loves the t.v.

Reviews.Title: Finding Nemo looks AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Alex Hayek
Reviews.Content: At first I thought, like some other reviewers, my Samsung TV wasn't working. I went online and found a short checklist to make sure everything was set-up properly. 1) was the TV plugged in? 2) After plugging in the TV did I press the power button? 3) Was it connected to my media player or computer? 4) Make sure all the cables were securely fastened. It could be one or any of these reasons that the TV wasn't displaying anything. For me it was all of them. It's been years since I bought a new TV and I guess I just kinda assumed the technology was good enough so that no set-up was required. That and it said plug and play. The plug part is VERY important! If you at plug the TV into a power outlet you can at least get what they call "snow" to show up on the screen. Don't stop there! This TV can do so much more!! I plugged a cable into my blu-ray player and then into the hole in the TV that fit the other end of the cable.  Nothing happened at first but my friend who is a technology whiz told me I had to press the source button on the remote. Oh man! Still nothing. I was starting to get a little frustrated because I didn't just want to look at snow, a burning fire over some logs would have been much more appealing than the pre-loaded snow video.  A couple weeks later my tech buddy just happened to stop over (I hate when people come by unannounced especially dealers).  He noticed that the remote felt light and asked to see the TV's packaging. He pulled out two small cylinders that were in a tight plastic wrapping and put them into a "secret" compartment in the remote control and pressed the source button. WOW!!! the snow switched to my favorite movie, Finding Nemo. The same movie I had wanted to watch when I fired up my blu-ray player many days before.  It's a brilliant movie about a small orange fish that was born with a horribly deformed small fin on one side of his little body. This fish is raised by an over-protective father fish that doesn't let Nemo experience the ocean like the other fish can. I don't blame the father fish though, because of what happens in the beginning of the film. I won't spoil it but a barracuda eats all of Nemo's brothers and sisters. The wife fish uses this as a clever way to cover up her escape from the boring father fish who thinks she is dead too. In the end little Nemo finally experiences a great adventure, overcoming many of life's obstacles (sharks and what not) in the process.  Anyway, it's a great film and I highly recommend it, thats why I'm giving this TV 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Lousy customer service
Reviews.Author: dlb "blue"
Reviews.Content: Samsung has the worst customer service I've run into. The TV did not work as advertised. I'd recumbent buying a Square Trade or other extended Warranty, you're more likely to get help from them than Samsung. Typical so why am I surprised? Time to look for another brand.

Reviews.Title: Offered "equivalent" for $100+ more? Hmmmm
Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: Received an email that the TV we ordered for $427ish was no longer available BUT we could buy an equivalent one for $100+ more.  Use caution from Circuit City.I just want the charged removed from my card!

Reviews.Title: NEVER BUY SAMSUNG!!!!
Reviews.Author: LLN
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung tv in 2008 for over $3,000 which has since become a paper weight because Samsung REFUSES to support it product. It has taken a class action law suit to receive any customer service from this company and the lawsuit was so narrow that it missed an additional issue that thousands of the affected tv's were beset with: faulty mainboards. This company is terrible and should be shut out of the US market for selling junk. DO NOT BUY THEIR PRODUCTS!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Flaw
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Samsung TVs. Love the picture, design, everything about them. Well, I guess I should say I was a fan. I purchased this TV to use with KRK studio monitors as the speakers, however this TV CANNOT CHANGE THE VOLUME if you're outputting your sound through the headphone jack. This is completely unacceptable! Let me repeat. If you are using the headphone jack on this TV, you have ZERO control over the volume. None. This is technology that is decades old, not rocket science! Now I have to look at other TVs that aren't arbitrarily limited for no reason. Thanks, Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5000 HDTV
Reviews.Author: bob carl
Reviews.Content: The 32 inch Samsung UN32EH5000 HDTV  arrived, The men in my life were unavailable to set up the new TV.  After 2 days I decided that I can read, and I followed the instructions, and did it my self.  (I am an 82 year old woman)  Your instructions were good.

Reviews.Title: Too Expensive
Reviews.Author: A. Davis
Reviews.Content: The Samsung TVs cost way too much.  You can get other brands with just as good picture for hundreds of dollars less.
